1.verse_text: Blessed is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the wicked, Nor standeth in the way of sinners, Nor sitteth in the seat of scoffers: And on his law doth he meditate day and night. That bringeth forth its fruit in its season, Whose leaf also doth not wither; And whatsoever he doeth shall prosper. But are like the chaff which the wind driveth away. Nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous. But the way of the wicked shall perish.
But his delight is in the law of Jehovah;
And he shall be like a tree planted by the streams of water,
Therefore the wicked shall not stand in the judgment,
For Jehovah knoweth the way of the righteous;

2.verse_text: Why do the nations rage, And the peoples meditate a vain thing? And the rulers take counsel together, Against Jehovah, and against his anointed, saying , And cast away their cords from us. The Lord will have them in derision. And vex them in his sore displeasure: Upon my holy hill of Zion. Jehovah said unto me, Thou art my son; This day have I begotten thee. And the uttermost parts of the earth for thy possession. Thou shalt dash them in pieces like a potter"s vessel. Be instructed, ye judges of the earth. And rejoice with trembling. For his wrath will soon be kindled. Blessed are all they that take refuge in him.
The kings of the earth set themselves,
Let us break their bonds asunder,
He that sitteth in the heavens will laugh:
Then will he speak unto them in his wrath,
Yet I have set my king
I will tell of the decree:
Ask of me, and I will give thee the nations for thine inheritance,
Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron;
Now therefore be wise, O ye kings:
Kiss the son, lest he be angry, and ye perish in the way,

3.verse_text: Jehovah, how are mine adversaries increased! Many are they that rise up against me. There is no help for him in God. [Selah My glory, and the lifter up of my head. And he answereth me out of his holy hill. [Selah I awaked; for Jehovah sustaineth me. That have set themselves against me round about. For thou hast smitten all mine enemies upon the cheek bone; Thou hast broken the teeth of the wicked. Thy blessing be upon thy people. [Selah
Many there are that say of my soul,
But thou, O Jehovah, art a shield about me;
I cry unto Jehovah with my voice,
I laid me down and slept;
I will not be afraid of ten thousands of the people
Arise, O Jehovah; save me, O my God:

4.verse_text: Answer me when I call, O God of my righteousness; Thou hast set me at large when I was in distress: Have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer. How long will ye love vanity, and seek after falsehood? [Selah Jehovah will hear when I call unto him. Commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still. [Selah And put your trust in Jehovah. Jehovah, lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us. More than they have when their grain and their new wine are increased. For thou, Jehovah, alone makest me dwell in safety.
O ye sons of men, how long shall my glory be turned into dishonor?
But know that Jehovah hath set apart for himself him that is godly:
Stand in awe, and sin not:
Many there are that say, Who will show us any good?
Thou hast put gladness in my heart,
In peace will I both lay me down and sleep;

5.verse_text: Give ear to my words, O Jehovah, Consider my meditation. For unto thee do I pray. In the morning will I order my prayer unto thee, and will keep watch. Evil shall not sojourn with thee. Thou hatest all workers of iniquity. Jehovah abhorreth the blood-thirsty and deceitful man. In thy fear will I worship toward thy holy temple. Make thy way straight before my face. Their inward part is very wickedness; Their throat is an open sepulchre; They flatter with their tongue. Let them fall by their own counsels; Thrust them out in the multitude of their transgressions; For they have rebelled against thee. Let them ever shout for joy, because thou defendest them: Let them also that love thy name be joyful in thee. O Jehovah, thou wilt compass him with favor as with a shield.
Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my God;
O Jehovah, in the morning shalt thou hear my voice;
For thou art not a God that hath pleasure in wickedness:
The arrogant shall not stand in thy sight:
Thou wilt destroy them that speak lies:
But as for me, in the abundance of thy lovingkindness will I come into thy house:
Lead me, O Jehovah, in thy righteousness because of mine enemies;
For there is no faithfulness in their mouth;
But let all those that take refuge in thee rejoice,
For thou wilt bless the righteous;

6.verse_text: O Jehovah, rebuke me not in thine anger, Neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure. O Jehovah, heal me; for my bones are troubled. And thou, O Jehovah, how long? Save me for thy lovingkindness" sake. In Sheol who shall give thee thanks? Every night make I my bed to swim; I water my couch with my tears. It waxeth old because of all mine adversaries. For Jehovah hath heard the voice of my weeping. Jehovah will receive my prayer. They shall turn back, they shall be put to shame suddenly.
Have mercy upon me, O Jehovah; for I am withered away:
My soul also is sore troubled:
Return, O Jehovah, deliver my soul:
For in death there is no remembrance of thee:
I am weary with my groaning;
Mine eye wasteth away because of grief;
Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity;
All mine enemies shall be put to shame and sore troubled:

7.verse_text: O Jehovah my God, in thee do I take refuge: Save me from all them that pursue me, and deliver me, Rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver. If there be iniquity in my hands; (Yea, I have delivered him that without cause was mine adversary); Yea, let him tread my life down to the earth, And lay my glory in the dust. [Selah Lift up thyself against the rage of mine adversaries, And awake for me; thou hast commanded judgment. And over them return thou on high. Judge me, O Jehovah, according to my righteousness, and to mine integrity that is in me. For the righteous God trieth the minds and hearts. Who saveth the upright in heart. Yea, a God that hath indignation every day. He hath bent his bow, and made it ready; He maketh his arrows fiery shafts . Yea, he hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood. And is fallen into the ditch which he made. And his violence shall come down upon his own pate. And will sing praise to the name of Jehovah Most High.
Lest they tear my soul like a lion,
O Jehovah my God, if I have done this;
If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me
Let the enemy pursue my soul, and overtake it;
Arise, O Jehovah, in thine anger;
And let the congregation of the peoples compass thee about;
Jehovah ministereth judgment to the peoples:
Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end, but establish thou the righteous:
If a man turn not, he will whet his sword;
He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death;
He hath made a pit, and digged it,
His mischief shall return upon his own head,
I will give thanks unto Jehovah according to his righteousness,

8.verse_text: O Jehovah, our Lord, How excellent is thy name in all the earth, Who hast set thy glory upon the heavens! Because of thine adversaries, That thou mightest still the enemy and the avenger. The moon and the stars, which thou hast ordained; And the son of man, that thou visitest him? And crownest him with glory and honor. Thou hast put all things under his feet: Yea, and the beasts of the field, Whatsoever passeth through the paths of the seas. How excellent is thy name in all the earth!
Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou established strength,
When I consider thy heavens, the work of thy fingers,
What is man, that thou art mindful of him?
For thou hast made him but little lower than God,
Thou makest him to have dominion over the works of thy hands;
The birds of the heavens, and the fish of the sea,

9.verse_text: I will give thanks unto Jehovah with my whole heart; I will show forth all thy marvellous works. I will sing praise to thy name, O thou Most High. They stumble and perish at thy presence. Thou sittest in the throne judging righteously. Thou hast blotted out their name for ever and ever. And the cities which thou hast overthrown, The very remembrance of them is perished. He hath prepared his throne for judgment; He will minister judgment to the peoples in uprightness. A high tower in times of trouble; For thou, Jehovah, hast not forsaken them that seek thee. Declare among the people his doings. He forgetteth not the cry of the poor. Behold my affliction which I suffer of them that hate me, Thou that liftest me up from the gates of death; In the gates of the daughter of Zion I will rejoice in thy salvation. In the net which they hid is their own foot taken. The wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. [Higgaion. Selah Even all the nations that forget God. Nor the expectation of the poor perish for ever. Let the nations be judged in thy sight. Let the nations know themselves to be but men. [Selah
I will be glad and exult in thee;
When mine enemies turn back,
For thou hast maintained my right and my cause;
Thou hast rebuked the nations, thou hast destroyed the wicked;
The enemy are come to an end, they are desolate for ever;
But Jehovah sitteth as king for ever:
And he will judge the world in righteousness,
Jehovah also will be a high tower for the oppressed,
And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee;
Sing praises to Jehovah, who dwelleth in Zion:
For he that maketh inquisition for blood remembereth them;
Have mercy upon me, O Jehovah;
That I may show forth all thy praise.
The nations are sunk down in the pit that they made:
Jehovah hath made himself known, he hath executed judgment:
The wicked shall be turned back unto Sheol,
For the needy shall not alway be forgotten,
Arise, O Jehovah; let not man prevail:
Put them in fear, O Jehovah:

10.verse_text: Why standest thou afar off, O Jehovah? Why hidest thou thyself in times of trouble? Let them be taken in the devices that they have conceived. And the covetous renounceth, yea , contemneth Jehovah. All his thoughts are, There is no God. Thy judgments are far above out of his sight: As for all his adversaries, he puffeth at them. To all generations I shall not be in adversity. Under his tongue is mischief and iniquity. In the secret places doth he murder the innocent; His eyes are privily set against the helpless. He lieth in wait to catch the poor: He doth catch the poor, when he draweth him in his net. And the helpless fall by his strong ones. He hideth his face, he will never see it. Forget not the poor. And say in his heart, Thou wilt not require it ? The helpless committeth himself unto thee; Thou hast been the helper of the fatherless. And as for the evil man, seek out his wickedness till thou find none. The nations are perished out of his land. Thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear; That man who is of the earth may be terrible no more.
In the pride of the wicked the poor is hotly pursued;
For the wicked boasteth of his heart"s desire,
The wicked, in the pride of his countenance, saith , He will not require it .
His ways are firm at all times;
He saith in his heart, I shall not be moved;
His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and oppression:
He sitteth in the lurking-places of the villages;
He lurketh in secret as a lion in his covert;
He saith in his heart: God hath forgotten;
Arise, O Jehovah; O God, lift up thy hand:
Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God,
Thou hast seen it ; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand:
Break thou the arm of the wicked;
Jehovah is King for ever and ever:
Jehovah, thou hast heard the desire of the meek:
To judge the fatherless and the oppressed,

11.verse_text: In Jehovah do I take refuge: How say ye to my soul, Flee as a bird to your mountain; They make ready their arrow upon the string, That they may shoot in darkness at the upright in heart; What can the righteous do? Jehovah, his throne is in heaven; His eyes behold, his eyelids try, the children of men. But the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth. Fire and brimstone and burning wind shall be the portion of their cup. The upright shall behold his face.
For, lo, the wicked bend the bow,
Jehovah is in his holy temple;
Upon the wicked he will rain snares;
For Jehovah is righteous; he loveth righteousness:

12.verse_text: Help, Jehovah; for the godly man ceaseth; For the faithful fail from among the children of men. With flattering lip, and with a double heart, do they speak. The tongue that speaketh great things; Our lips are our own: who is lord over us? Now will I arise, saith Jehovah; I will set him in the safety he panteth for. As silver tried in a furnace on the earth, Purified seven times. Thou wilt preserve them from this generation for ever. When vileness is exalted among the sons of men.
They speak falsehood every one with his neighbor:
Jehovah will cut off all flattering lips,
Who have said, With our tongue will we prevail;
Because of the oppression of the poor, because of the sighing of the needy,
The words of Jehovah are pure words;
Thou wilt keep them, O Jehovah,
The wicked walk on every side,

13.verse_text: How long, O Jehovah? wilt thou forget me for ever? How long wilt thou hide thy face from me? Having sorrow in my heart all the day? How long shall mine enemy be exalted over me? Lighten mine eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death; Lest mine adversaries rejoice when I am moved. My heart shall rejoice in thy salvation. Because he hath dealt bountifully with me.
How long shall I take counsel in my soul,
Consider and answer me, O Jehovah my God:
Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him;
But I have trusted in thy lovingkindness;

14.verse_text: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. They are corrupt, they have done abominable works; There is none that doeth good. To see if there were any that did understand, That did seek after God. There is none that doeth good, no, not one. Who eat up my people as they eat bread, And call not upon Jehovah? For God is in the generation of the righteous. Because Jehovah is his refuge. When Jehovah bringeth back the captivity of his people, Then shall Jacob rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
Jehovah looked down from heaven upon the children of men,
They are all gone aside; they are together become filthy;
Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge,
There were they in great fear;
Ye put to shame the counsel of the poor,
Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion!

15.verse_text: Jehovah, who shall sojourn in thy tabernacle? Who shall dwell in thy holy hill? And speaketh truth in his heart; Nor doeth evil to his friend, Nor taketh up a reproach against his neighbor; But who honoreth them that fear Jehovah; He that sweareth to his own hurt, and changeth not; Nor taketh reward against the innocent. He that doeth these things shall never be moved.
He that walketh uprightly, and worketh righteousness,
He that slandereth not with his tongue,
In whose eyes a reprobate is despised,
He that putteth not out his money to interest,

16.verse_text: Preserve me, O God; for in thee do I take refuge. I have no good beyond thee. They are the excellent in whom is all my delight. Their drink-offerings of blood will I not offer, Nor take their names upon my lips. Thou maintainest my lot. Yea, I have a goodly heritage. Yea, my heart instructeth me in the night seasons. Because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved. My flesh also shall dwell in safety. Neither wilt thou suffer thy holy one to see corruption. In thy presence is fulness of joy; In thy right hand there are pleasures for evermore.
O my soul , thou hast said unto Jehovah, Thou art my Lord:
As for the saints that are in the earth,
Their sorrows shall be multiplied that give gifts for another god :
Jehovah is the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup:
The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant places;
I will bless Jehovah, who hath given me counsel;
I have set Jehovah always before me:
Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth:
For thou wilt not leave my soul to Sheol;
Thou wilt show me the path of life:

17.verse_text: Hear the right, O Jehovah, attend unto my cry; Give ear unto my prayer, that goeth not out of feigned lips. Let thine eyes look upon equity. Thou hast tried me, and findest nothing; I am purposed that my mouth shall not transgress. I have kept me from the ways of the violent. My feet have not slipped. Incline thine ear unto me, and hear my speech. O thou that savest by thy right hand them that take refuge in thee From those that rise up against them . Hide me under the shadow of thy wings, My deadly enemies, that compass me about. With their mouth they speak proudly. They set their eyes to cast us down to the earth. And as it were a young lion lurking in secret places. Confront him, cast him down: Deliver my soul from the wicked by thy sword; From men of the world, whose portion is in this life, And whose belly thou fillest with thy treasure: They are satisfied with children, And leave the rest of their substance to their babes. I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with beholding thy form.
Let my sentence come forth from thy presence;
Thou hast proved my heart; thou hast visited me in the night;
As for the works of men, by the word of thy lips
My steps have held fast to thy paths,
I have called upon thee, for thou wilt answer me, O God:
Keep me as the apple of the eye;
From the wicked that oppress me,
They are inclosed in their own fat:
They have now compassed us in our steps;
He is like a lion that is greedy of his prey,
From men by thy hand, O Jehovah,
As for me, I shall behold thy face in righteousness;

18.verse_text: I love thee, O Jehovah, my strength. My God, my rock, in whom I will take refuge; My shield, and the horn of my salvation, my high tower. So shall I be saved from mine enemies. And the floods of ungodliness made me afraid. The snares of death came upon me. And cried unto my God: He heard my voice out of his temple, And my cry before him came into his ears. The foundations also of the mountains quaked And were shaken, because he was wroth. And fire out of his mouth devoured: Coals were kindled by it. And thick darkness was under his feet. Yea, he soared upon the wings of the wind. Darkness of waters, thick clouds of the skies. Hailstones and coals of fire. And the Most High uttered his voice, Hailstones and coals of fire. Yea, lightnings manifold, and discomfited them. And the foundations of the world were laid bare, At thy rebuke, O Jehovah, At the blast of the breath of thy nostrils. He drew me out of many waters. And from them that hated me; for they were too mighty for me. But Jehovah was my stay. He delivered me, because he delighted in me. According to the cleanness of my hands hath he recompensed me. And have not wickedly departed from my God. And I put not away his statutes from me. And I kept myself from mine iniquity. According to the cleanness of my hands in his eyesight. With the perfect man thou wilt show thyself perfect; And with the perverse thou wilt show thyself froward. But the haughty eyes thou wilt bring down. Jehovah my God will lighten my darkness. And by my God do I leap over a wall. The word of Jehovah is tried; He is a shield unto all them that take refuge in him. And who is a rock, besides our God, And maketh my way perfect? And setteth me upon my high places. So that mine arms do bend a bow of brass. And thy right hand hath holden me up, And thy gentleness hath made me great. And my feet have not slipped. Neither will I turn again till they are consumed. They shall fall under my feet. Thou hast subdued under me those that rose up against me. That I might cut off them that hate me. Even unto Jehovah, but he answered them not. I did cast them out as the mire of the streets. Thou hast made me the head of the nations: A people whom I have not known shall serve me. The foreigners shall submit themselves unto me. And shall come trembling out of their close places. And exalted be the God of my salvation, And subdueth peoples under me. Yea, thou liftest me up above them that rise up against me; Thou deliverest me from the violent man. And will sing praises unto thy name. And showeth lovingkindness to his anointed, To David and to his seed, for evermore.
Jehovah is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer;
I will call upon Jehovah, who is worthy to be praised:
The cords of death compassed me,
The cords of Sheol were round about me;
In my distress I called upon Jehovah,
Then the earth shook and trembled;
There went up a smoke out of his nostrils,
He bowed the heavens also, and came down;
And he rode upon a cherub, and did fly;
He made darkness his hiding-place, his pavilion round about him,
At the brightness before him his thick clouds passed,
Jehovah also thundered in the heavens,
And he sent out his arrows, and scattered them;
Then the channels of waters appeared,
He sent from on high, he took me;
He delivered me from my strong enemy,
They came upon me in the day of my calamity;
He brought me forth also into a large place;
Jehovah hath rewarded me according to my righteousness;
For I have kept the ways of Jehovah,
For all his ordinances were before me,
I was also perfect with him,
Therefore hath Jehovah recompensed me according to my righteousness,
With the merciful thou wilt show thyself merciful;
With the pure thou wilt show thyself pure;
For thou wilt save the afflicted people;
For thou wilt light my lamp:
For by thee I run upon a troop;
As for God, his way is perfect:
For who is God, save Jehovah?
The God that girdeth me with strength,
He maketh my feet like hinds" feet :
He teacheth my hands to war;
Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation;
Thou hast enlarged my steps under me,
I will pursue mine enemies, and overtake them;
I will smite them through, so that they shall not be able to rise:
For thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle:
Thou hast also made mine enemies turn their backs unto me,
They cried, but there was none to save;
Then did I beat them small as the dust before the wind;
Thou hast delivered me from the strivings of the people;
As soon as they hear of me they shall obey me;
The foreigners shall fade away,
Jehovah liveth; and blessed be my rock;
Even the God that executeth vengeance for me,
He rescueth me from mine enemies;
Therefore I will give thanks unto thee, O Jehovah, among the nations,
Great deliverance giveth he to his king,

19.verse_text: The heavens declare the glory of God; And the firmament showeth his handiwork. And night unto night showeth knowledge. Their voice is not heard. And their words to the end of the world. In them hath he set a tabernacle for the sun, And rejoiceth as a strong man to run his course. And his circuit unto the ends of it; And there is nothing hid from the heat thereof. The testimony of Jehovah is sure, making wise the simple. The commandment of Jehovah is pure, enlightening the eyes. The ordinances of Jehovah are true, and righteous altogether. Sweeter also than honey and the droppings of the honeycomb. In keeping them there is great reward. Clear thou me from hidden faults . Let them not have dominion over me: Then shall I be upright, And I shall be clear from great transgression. Be acceptable in thy sight, O Jehovah, my rock, and my redeemer.
There is no speech nor language;
Their line is gone out through all the earth,
Which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber,
His going forth is from the end of the heavens,
The law of Jehovah is perfect, restoring the soul:
The precepts of Jehovah are right, rejoicing the heart:
The fear of Jehovah is clean, enduring for ever:
More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold;
Moreover by them is thy servant warned:
Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous sins ;
Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart

20.verse_text: Jehovah answer thee in the day of trouble; The name of the God of Jacob set thee up on high; And strengthen thee out of Zion; And accept thy burnt-sacrifice; [Selah And fulfil all thy counsel. And in the name of our God we will set up our banners: Jehovah fulfil all thy petitions. He will answer him from his holy heaven With the saving strength of his right hand. But we will make mention of the name of Jehovah our God. But we are risen, and stand upright. Let the King answer us when we call.
Send thee help from the sanctuary,
We will triumph in thy salvation,
Now know I that Jehovah saveth his anointed;
Some trust in chariots, and some in horses;
They are bowed down and fallen;

21.verse_text: The king shall joy in thy strength, O Jehovah; And in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice! And hast not withholden the request of his lips. [Selah Thou settest a crown of fine gold on his head. Even length of days for ever and ever. Honor and majesty dost thou lay upon him. Thou makest him glad with joy in thy presence. And through the lovingkindness of the Most High he shall not be moved. Thy right hand will find out those that hate thee. Jehovah will swallow them up in his wrath, And the fire shall devour them. And their seed from among the children of men. They conceived a device which they are not able to perform. Thou wilt make ready with thy bowstrings against their face. So will we sing and praise thy power.
Thou hast given him his heart"s desire,
For thou meetest him with the blessings of goodness:
He asked life of thee, thou gavest it him,
His glory is great in thy salvation:
For thou makest him most blessed for ever:
For the king trusteth in Jehovah;
Thy hand will find out all thine enemies;
Thou wilt make them as a fiery furnace in the time of thine anger:
Their fruit wilt thou destroy from the earth,
For they intended evil against thee;
For thou wilt make them turn their back;
Be thou exalted, O Jehovah, in thy strength:

22.verse_text: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me? Why art thou so far from helping me, and from the words of my groaning? And in the night season, and am not silent. O thou that inhabitest the praises of Israel. They trusted, and thou didst deliver them. They trusted in thee, and were not put to shame. A reproach of men, and despised of the people. They shoot out the lip, they shake the head, saying , Let him rescue him, seeing he delighteth in him. Thou didst make me trust when I was upon my mother"s breasts. Thou art my God since my mother bare me. For there is none to help. Strong bulls of Bashan have beset me round. As a ravening and a roaring lion. And all my bones are out of joint: My heart is like wax; It is melted within me. And my tongue cleaveth to my jaws; And thou hast brought me into the dust of death. A company of evil-doers have inclosed me; They pierced my hands and my feet. They look and stare upon me; And upon my vesture do they cast lots. O thou my succor, haste thee to help me. My darling from the power of the dog. Yea, from the horns of the wild-oxen thou hast answered me. In the midst of the assembly will I praise thee. All ye the seed of Jacob, glorify him; And stand in awe of him, all ye the seed of Israel. Neither hath he hid his face from him; But when he cried unto him, he heard. I will pay my vows before them that fear him. They shall praise Jehovah that seek after him: Let your heart live for ever. And all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before thee. And he is the ruler over the nations. All they that go down to the dust shall bow before him, Even he that cannot keep his soul alive. It shall be told of the Lord unto the next generation. Unto a people that shall be born, that he hath done it.
O my God, I cry in the daytime, but thou answerest not;
But thou art holy,
Our fathers trusted in thee:
They cried unto thee, and were delivered:
But I am a worm, and no man;
All they that see me laugh me to scorn:
Commit thyself unto Jehovah; let him deliver him:
But thou art he that took me out of the womb;
I was cast upon thee from the womb;
Be not far from me; for trouble is near;
Many bulls have compassed me;
They gape upon me with their mouth,
I am poured out like water,
My strength is dried up like a potsherd;
For dogs have compassed me:
I may count all my bones.
They part my garments among them,
But be not thou far off, O Jehovah:
Deliver my soul from the sword,
Save me from the lion"s mouth;
I will declare thy name unto my brethren:
Ye that fear Jehovah, praise him;
For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted;
Of thee cometh my praise in the great assembly:
The meek shall eat and be satisfied;
All the ends of the earth shall remember and turn unto Jehovah;
For the kingdom is Jehovah"s;
All the fat ones of the earth shall eat and worship:
A seed shall serve him;
They shall come and shall declare his righteousness

23.verse_text: Jehovah is my shepherd; I shall not want. He leadeth me beside still waters. He guideth me in the paths of righteousness for his name"s sake. I will fear no evil; for thou art with me; Thy rod and thy staff, they comfort me. Thou hast anointed my head with oil; My cup runneth over. And I shall dwell in the house of Jehovah for ever.
He maketh me to lie down in green pastures;
Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death,
Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies:
Surely goodness and lovingkindness shall follow me all the days of my life;

24.verse_text: The earth is Jehovah"s, and the fulness thereof; The world, and they that dwell therein. And established it upon the floods. And who shall stand in his holy place? Who hath not lifted up his soul unto falsehood, And hath not sworn deceitfully. And righteousness from the God of his salvation. That seek thy face, even Jacob. [Selah And be ye lifted up, ye everlasting doors: And the King of glory will come in. Jehovah strong and mighty, Jehovah mighty in battle. Yea, lift them up, ye everlasting doors: And the King of glory will come in. Jehovah of hosts, He is the King of glory. [Selah
For he hath founded it upon the seas,
Who shall ascend into the hill of Jehovah?
He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart;
He shall receive a blessing from Jehovah,
This is the generation of them that seek after him,
Lift up your heads, O ye gates;
Who is the King of glory?
Lift up your heads, O ye gates;
Who is this King of glory?

25.verse_text: Unto thee, O Jehovah, do I lift up my soul. Let me not be put to shame; Let not mine enemies triumph over me. They shall be put to shame that deal treacherously without cause. Teach me thy paths. For thou art the God of my salvation; For thee do I wait all the day. For they have been ever of old. According to thy lovingkindness remember thou me, For thy goodness" sake, O Jehovah. Therefore will he instruct sinners in the way. And the meek will he teach his way. Unto such as keep his covenant and his testimonies. Pardon mine iniquity, for it is great. Him shall he instruct in the way that he shall choose. And his seed shall inherit the land. And he will show them his covenant. For he will pluck my feet out of the net. For I am desolate and afflicted. Oh bring thou me out of my distresses. And forgive all my sins. And they hate me with cruel hatred. Let me not be put to shame, for I take refuge in thee. For I wait for thee. Out of all his troubles.
O my God, in thee have I trusted,
Yea, none that wait for thee shall be put to shame:
Show me thy ways, O Jehovah;
Guide me in thy truth, and teach me;
Remember, O Jehovah, thy tender mercies and thy lovingkindness;
Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions:
Good and upright is Jehovah:
The meek will he guide in justice;
All the paths of Jehovah are lovingkindness and truth
For thy name"s sake, O Jehovah,
What man is he that feareth Jehovah?
His soul shall dwell at ease;
The friendship of Jehovah is with them that fear him;
Mine eyes are ever toward Jehovah;
Turn thee unto me, and have mercy upon me;
The troubles of my heart are enlarged:
Consider mine affliction and my travail;
Consider mine enemies, for they are many;
Oh keep my soul, and deliver me:
Let integrity and uprightness preserve me,
Redeem Israel, O God,

26.verse_text: Judge me, O Jehovah, for I have walked in mine integrity: I have trusted also in Jehovah without wavering. Try my heart and my mind. And I have walked in thy truth. Neither will I go in with dissemblers. And will not sit with the wicked. So will I compass thine altar, O Jehovah; And tell of all thy wondrous works. And the place where thy glory dwelleth. Nor my life with men of blood; And their right hand is full of bribes. Redeem me, and be merciful unto me. In the congregations will I bless Jehovah.
Examine me, O Jehovah, and prove me;
For thy lovingkindness is before mine eyes;
I have not sat with men of falsehood;
I hate the assembly of evil-doers,
I will wash my hands in innocency:
That I may make the voice of thanksgiving to be heard,
Jehovah, I love the habitation of thy house,
Gather not my soul with sinners,
But as for me, I will walk in mine integrity:
My foot standeth in an even place:

27.verse_text: Jehovah is my light and my salvation; Whom shall I fear? Jehovah is the strength of my life; Of whom shall I be afraid? Even mine adversaries and my foes, they stumbled and fell. My heart shall not fear: Though war should rise against me, Even then will I be confident. That I may dwell in the house of Jehovah all the days of my life, To behold the beauty of Jehovah, And to inquire in his temple. In the covert of his tabernacle will he hide me; He will lift me up upon a rock. And I will offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto Jehovah. Have mercy also upon me, and answer me. Thy face, Jehovah, will I seek. Put not thy servant away in anger: Thou hast been my help; Cast me not off, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation. Then Jehovah will take me up. And lead me in a plain path, Because of mine enemies. For false witnesses are risen up against me, And such as breathe out cruelty. In the land of the living. Be strong, and let thy heart take courage; Yea, wait thou for Jehovah.
When evil-doers came upon me to eat up my flesh,
Though a host should encamp against me,
One thing have I asked of Jehovah, that will I seek after:
For in the day of trouble he will keep me secretly in his pavilion:
And now shall my head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me;
Hear, O Jehovah, when I cry with my voice:
When thou saidst , Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee,
Hide not thy face from me;
When my father and my mother forsake me,
Teach me thy way, O Jehovah;
Deliver me not over unto the will of mine adversaries:
I had fainted , unless I had believed to see the goodness of Jehovah

28.verse_text: Unto thee, O Jehovah, will I call: My rock, be not thou deaf unto me; Lest, if thou be silent unto me, I become like them that go down into the pit. When I lift up my hands toward thy holy oracle. And with the workers of iniquity; That speak peace with their neighbors, But mischief is in their hearts. Give them after the operation of their hands; Render to them their desert. Nor the operation of his hands, He will break them down and not build them up. Because he hath heard the voice of my supplications. My heart hath trusted in him, and I am helped: Therefore my heart greatly rejoiceth; And with my song will I praise him. And he is a stronghold of salvation to his anointed. Be their shepherd also, and bear them up for ever.
Hear the voice of my supplications, when I cry unto thee,
Draw me not away with the wicked,
Give them according to their work, and according to the wickedness of their doings:
Because they regard not the works of Jehovah,
Jehovah is my strength and my shield;
Save thy people, and bless thine inheritance:

29.verse_text: Ascribe unto Jehovah, O ye sons of the mighty, Ascribe unto Jehovah glory and strength. Worship Jehovah in holy array. The God of glory thundereth, Even Jehovah upon many waters. The voice of Jehovah is full of majesty. Yea, Jehovah breaketh in pieces the cedars of Lebanon. Lebanon and Sirion like a young wild-ox. Jehovah shaketh the wilderness of Kadesh. And strippeth the forests bare: And in his temple everything saith, Glory. Yea, Jehovah sitteth as King for ever. Jehovah will bless his people with peace.
Ascribe unto Jehovah the glory due unto his name;
The voice of Jehovah is upon the waters:
The voice of Jehovah is powerful;
The voice of Jehovah breaketh the cedars;
He maketh them also to skip like a calf;
The voice of Jehovah cleaveth the flames of fire.
The voice of Jehovah shaketh the wilderness;
The voice of Jehovah maketh the hinds to calve,
Jehovah sat as King at the Flood;
Jehovah will give strength unto his people;

30.verse_text: I will extol thee, O Jehovah; for thou hast raised me up, And hast not made my foes to rejoice over me. I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me. Thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit. And give thanks to his holy memorial name . His favor is for a life-time: Weeping may tarry for the night, But joy cometh in the morning. I shall never be moved. Thou didst hide thy face; I was troubled. And unto Jehovah I made supplication: Shall the dust praise thee? shall it declare thy truth? Jehovah, be thou my helper. Thou hast loosed my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness; O Jehovah my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.
O Jehovah, thou hast brought up my soul from Sheol;
Sing praise unto Jehovah, O ye saints of his,
For his anger is but for a moment;
As for me, I said in my prosperity,
Thou, Jehovah, of thy favor hadst made my mountain to stand strong:
I cried to thee, O Jehovah;
What profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit?
Hear, O Jehovah, and have mercy upon me:
Thou hast turned for me my mourning into dancing;
To the end that my glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent.

31.verse_text: In thee, O Jehovah, do I take refuge; Let me never be put to shame: Deliver me in thy righteousness. Be thou to me a strong rock, A house of defence to save me. Therefore for thy name"s sake lead me and guide me. For thou art my stronghold. Thou hast redeemed me, O Jehovah, thou God of truth. But I trust in Jehovah. For thou hast seen my affliction: Thou hast known my soul in adversities; Thou hast set my feet in a large place. Mine eye wasteth away with grief, yea , my soul and my body. And my years with sighing: My strength faileth because of mine iniquity, And my bones are wasted away. Yea, unto my neighbors exceedingly, And a fear to mine acquaintance: They that did see me without fled from me. I am like a broken vessel. Terror on every side: While they took counsel together against me, They devised to take away my life. I said, Thou art my God. Deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me. Save me in thy lovingkindness. Let the wicked be put to shame, let them be silent in Sheol. Which speak against the righteous insolently, With pride and contempt. Which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee, Which thou hast wrought for them that take refuge in thee, Before the sons of men! Thou wilt keep them secretly in a pavilion from the strife of tongues. For he hath showed me his marvellous lovingkindness in a strong city. I am cut off from before thine eyes: Nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications, When I cried unto thee. Jehovah preserveth the faithful, And plentifully rewardeth him that dealeth proudly. All ye that hope in Jehovah.
Bow down thine ear unto me; deliver me speedily:
For thou art my rock and my fortress;
Pluck me out of the net that they have laid privily for me;
Into thy hand I commend my spirit:
I hate them that regard lying vanities;
I will be glad and rejoice in thy lovingkindness;
And thou hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy;
Have mercy upon me, O Jehovah, for I am in distress:
For my life is spent with sorrow,
Because of all mine adversaries I am become a reproach,
I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind:
For I have heard the defaming of many,
But I trusted in thee, O Jehovah:
My times are in thy hand:
Make thy face to shine upon thy servant:
Let me not be put to shame, O Jehovah; for I have called upon thee:
Let the lying lips be dumb,
Oh how great is thy goodness,
In the covert of thy presence wilt thou hide them from the plottings of man:
Blessed be Jehovah;
As for me, I said in my haste,
Oh love Jehovah, all ye his saints:
Be strong, and let your heart take courage,

32.verse_text: Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, Whose sin is covered. And in whose spirit there is no guile. Through my groaning all the day long. My moisture was changed as with the drought of summer. [Selah And mine iniquity did I not hide: I said, I will confess my transgressions unto Jehovah; And thou forgavest the iniquity of my sin. [Selah Surely when the great waters overflow they shall not reach unto him. Thou wilt compass me about with songs of deliverance. [Selah I will counsel thee with mine eye upon thee. Whose trappings must be bit and bridle to hold them in, Else they will not come near unto thee. But he that trusteth in Jehovah, lovingkindness shall compass him about. And shout for joy, all ye that are upright in heart.
Blessed is the man unto whom Jehovah imputeth not iniquity,
When I kept silence, my bones wasted away
For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me:
I acknowledged my sin unto thee,
For this let every one that is godly pray unto thee in a time when thou mayest be found:
Thou art my hiding-place; thou wilt preserve me from trouble;
I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go:
Be ye not as the horse, or as the mule, which have no understanding;
Many sorrows shall be to the wicked;
Be glad in Jehovah, and rejoice, ye righteous;

33.verse_text: Rejoice in Jehovah, O ye righteous: Praise is comely for the upright. Sing praises unto him with the psaltery of ten strings. Play skilfully with a loud noise. And all his work is done in faithfulness. The earth is full of the lovingkindness of Jehovah. And all the host of them by the breath of his mouth. He layeth up the deeps in store-houses. Let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of him. He commanded, and it stood fast. He maketh the thoughts of the peoples to be of no effect. The thoughts of his heart to all generations. The people whom he hath chosen for his own inheritance. He beholdeth all the sons of men; Upon all the inhabitants of the earth, That considereth all their works. A mighty man is not delivered by great strength. Neither doth he deliver any by his great power. Upon them that hope in his lovingkindness; And to keep them alive in famine. He is our help and our shield. Because we have trusted in his holy name. According as we have hoped in thee.
Give thanks unto Jehovah with the harp:
Sing unto him a new song;
For the word of Jehovah is right;
He loveth righteousness and justice:
By the word of Jehovah were the heavens made,
He gathereth the waters of the sea together as a heap:
Let all the earth fear Jehovah:
For he spake, and it was done;
Jehovah bringeth the counsel of the nations to nought;
The counsel of Jehovah standeth fast for ever,
Blessed is the nation whose God is Jehovah,
Jehovah looketh from heaven;
From the place of his habitation he looketh forth
He that fashioneth the hearts of them all,
There is no king saved by the multitude of a host:
A horse is a vain thing for safety;
Behold, the eye of Jehovah is upon them that fear him,
To deliver their soul from death,
Our soul hath waited for Jehovah:
For our heart shall rejoice in him,
Let thy lovingkindness, O Jehovah, be upon us,

34.verse_text: I will bless Jehovah at all times: His praise shall continually be in my mouth. The meek shall hear thereof, and be glad. And let us exalt his name together. And delivered me from all my fears. And their faces shall never be confounded. And saved him out of all his troubles. And delivereth them. Blessed is the man that taketh refuge in him. For there is no want to them that fear him. But they that seek Jehovah shall not want any good thing. I will teach you the fear of Jehovah. And loveth many days, that he may see good? And thy lips from speaking guile. Seek peace, and pursue it. And his ears are open unto their cry. To cut off the remembrance of them from the earth. And delivered them out of all their troubles. And saveth such as are of a contrite spirit. But Jehovah delivereth him out of them all. Not one of them is broken. And they that hate the righteous shall be condemned. And none of them that take refuge in him shall be condemned.
My soul shall make her boast in Jehovah:
Oh magnify Jehovah with me,
I sought Jehovah, and he answered me,
They looked unto him, and were radiant;
This poor man cried, and Jehovah heard him,
The angel of Jehovah encampeth round about them that fear him,
Oh taste and see that Jehovah is good:
Oh fear Jehovah, ye his saints;
The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger;
Come, ye children, hearken unto me:
What man is he that desireth life,
Keep thy tongue from evil,
Depart from evil, and do good;
The eyes of Jehovah are toward the righteous,
The face of Jehovah is against them that do evil,
The righteous cried, and Jehovah heard,
Jehovah is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart,
Many are the afflictions of the righteous;
He keepeth all his bones:
Evil shall slay the wicked;
Jehovah redeemeth the soul of his servants;

35.verse_text: Strive thou, O Jehovah, with them that strive with me: Fight thou against them that fight against me. And stand up for my help. Say unto my soul, I am thy salvation. Let them be turned back and confounded that devise my hurt. And the angel of Jehovah driving them on. And the angel of Jehovah pursuing them. Without cause have they digged a pit for my soul. And let his net that he hath hid catch himself: With destruction let him fall therein. It shall rejoice in his salvation. Who deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him, Yea, the poor and the needy from him that robbeth him? They ask me of things that I know not. To the bereaving of my soul. I afflicted my soul with fasting; And my prayer returned into mine own bosom. I bowed down mourning, as one that bewaileth his mother. The abjects gathered themselves together against me, and I knew it not; They did tear me, and ceased not: They gnashed upon me with their teeth. Rescue my soul from their destructions, My darling from the lions. I will praise thee among much people. Neither let them wink with the eye that hate me without a cause. But they devise deceitful words against them that are quiet in the land. They said, Aha, aha, our eye hath seen it. O Lord, be not far from me. Even unto my cause, my God and my Lord. And let them not rejoice over me. Let them not say, We have swallowed him up. Let them be clothed with shame and dishonor that magnify themselves against me. Yea, let them say continually, Jehovah be magnified, Who hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant. And of thy praise all the day long.
Take hold of shield and buckler,
Draw out also the spear, and stop the way against them that pursue me:
Let them be put to shame and brought to dishonor that seek after my soul:
Let them be as chaff before the wind,
Let their way be dark and slippery,
For without cause have they hid for me their net in a pit;
Let destruction come upon him unawares;
And my soul shall be joyful in Jehovah:
All my bones shall say, Jehovah, who is like unto thee,
Unrighteous witnesses rise up;
They reward me evil for good,
But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth:
I behaved myself as though it had been my friend or my brother:
But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together:
Like the profane mockers in feasts,
Lord, how long wilt thou look on?
I will give thee thanks in the great assembly:
Let not them that are mine enemies wrongfully rejoice over me;
For they speak not peace;
Yea, they opened their mouth wide against me;
Thou hast seen it, O Jehovah; keep not silence:
Stir up thyself, and awake to the justice due unto me,
Judge me, O Jehovah my God, according to thy righteousness;
Let them not say in their heart, Aha, so would we have it:
Let them be put to shame and confounded together that rejoice at my hurt:
Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favor my righteous cause:
And my tongue shall talk of thy righteousness

36.verse_text: The transgression of the wicked saith within my heart, There is no fear of God before his eyes. That his iniquity will not be found out and be hated. He hath ceased to be wise and to do good. He setteth himself in a way that is not good; He abhorreth not evil. Thy faithfulness reacheth unto the skies. Thy judgments are a great deep: O Jehovah, thou preservest man and beast. And the children of men take refuge under the shadow of thy wings. And thou wilt make them drink of the river of thy pleasures. In thy light shall we see light. And thy righteousness to the upright in heart. And let not the hand of the wicked drive me away. They are thrust down, and shall not be able to rise.
For he flattereth himself in his own eyes,
The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit:
He deviseth iniquity upon his bed;
Thy lovingkindness, O Jehovah, is in the heavens;
Thy righteousness is like the mountains of God;
How precious is thy lovingkindness, O God!
They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house;
For with thee is the fountain of life:
Oh continue thy lovingkindness unto them that know thee,
Let not the foot of pride come against me,
There are the workers of iniquity fallen:

37.verse_text: Fret not thyself because of evil-doers, Neither be thou envious against them that work unrighteousness. And wither as the green herb. Dwell in the land, and feed on his faithfulness. And he will give thee the desires of thy heart. Trust also in him, and he will bring it to pass. And thy justice as the noonday. Fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his way, Because of the man who bringeth wicked devices to pass. Fret not thyself, it tendeth only to evil-doing. But those that wait for Jehovah, they shall inherit the land. Yea, thou shalt diligently consider his place, and he shall not be. And shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace. And gnasheth upon him with his teeth. For he seeth that his day is coming. To cast down the poor and needy, To slay such as are upright in the way. And their bows shall be broken. Than the abundance of many wicked. But Jehovah upholdeth the righteous. And their inheritance shall be for ever. And in the days of famine they shall be satisfied. And the enemies of Jehovah shall be as the fat of lambs: They shall consume; in smoke shall they consume away. But the righteous dealeth graciously, and giveth. And they that are cursed of him shall be cut off. And he delighteth in his way. For Jehovah upholdeth him with his hand. Yet have I not seen the righteous forsaken, Nor his seed begging bread. And his seed is blessed. And dwell for evermore. And forsaketh not his saints; They are preserved for ever: But the seed of the wicked shall be cut off. And dwell therein for ever. And his tongue speaketh justice. None of his steps shall slide. And seeketh to slay him. Nor condemn him when he is judged. And he will exalt thee to inherit the land: When the wicked are cut off, thou shalt see it. And spreading himself like a green tree in its native soil. Yea, I sought him, but he could not be found. For there is a happy end to the man of peace. The end of the wicked shall be cut off. He is their stronghold in the time of trouble. He rescueth them from the wicked, and saveth them, Because they have taken refuge in him.
For they shall soon be cut down like the grass,
Trust in Jehovah, and do good;
Delight thyself also in Jehovah;
Commit thy way unto Jehovah;
And he will make thy righteousness to go forth as the light,
Rest in Jehovah, and wait patiently for him:
Cease from anger, and forsake wrath:
For evil-doers shall be cut off;
For yet a little while, and the wicked shall not be:
But the meek shall inherit the land,
The wicked plotteth against the just,
The Lord will laugh at him;
The wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow,
Their sword shall enter into their own heart,
Better is a little that the righteous hath
For the arms of the wicked shall be broken;
Jehovah knoweth the days of the perfect;
They shall not be put to shame in the time of evil;
But the wicked shall perish,
The wicked borroweth, and payeth not again;
For such as are blessed of him shall inherit the land;
A man"s goings are established of Jehovah;
Though he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down;
I have been young, and now am old;
All the day long he dealeth graciously, and lendeth;
Depart from evil, and do good;
For Jehovah loveth justice,
The righteous shall inherit the land,
The mouth of the righteous talketh of wisdom,
The law of his God is in his heart;
The wicked watcheth the righteous,
Jehovah will not leave him in his hand,
Wait for Jehovah, and keep his way,
I have seen the wicked in great power,
But one passed by, and, lo, he was not:
Mark the perfect man, and behold the upright;
As for transgressors, they shall be destroyed together:
But the salvation of the righteous is of Jehovah:
And Jehovah helpeth them, and rescueth them:

38.verse_text: O Jehovah, rebuke me not in thy wrath; Neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure. And thy hand presseth me sore. Neither is there any health in my bones because of my sin. As a heavy burden they are too heavy for me. Because of my foolishness. I go mourning all the day long. And there is no soundness in my flesh. I have groaned by reason of the disquietness of my heart. And my groaning is not hid from thee. As for the light of mine eyes, it also is gone from me. And my kinsmen stand afar off. And they that seek my hurt speak mischievous things, And meditate deceits all the day long. And I am as a dumb man that openeth not his mouth. And in whose mouth are no reproofs. Thou wilt answer, O Lord my God. When my foot slippeth, they magnify themselves against me. And my sorrow is continually before me. I will be sorry for my sin. And they that hate me wrongfully are multiplied. Are adversaries unto me, because I follow the thing that is good. O my God, be not far from me. O Lord, my salvation.
For thine arrows stick fast in me,
There is no soundness in my flesh because of thine indignation;
For mine iniquities are gone over my head:
My wounds are loathsome and corrupt,
I am pained and bowed down greatly;
For my loins are filled with burning;
I am faint and sore bruised:
Lord, all my desire is before thee;
My heart throbbeth, my strength faileth me:
My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my plague;
They also that seek after my life lay snares for me ;
But I, as a deaf man, hear not;
Yea, I am as a man that heareth not,
For in thee, O Jehovah, do I hope:
For I said, Lest they rejoice over me:
For I am ready to fall,
For I will declare mine iniquity;
But mine enemies are lively, and are strong;
They also that render evil for good
Forsake me not, O Jehovah:
Make haste to help me,

39.verse_text: I said, I will take heed to my ways, That I sin not with my tongue: I will keep my mouth with a bridle, While the wicked is before me. And my sorrow was stirred. While I was musing the fire burned; Then spake I with my tongue: And the measure of my days, what it is; Let me know how frail I am. And my life-time is as nothing before thee: Surely every man at his best estate is altogether vanity. [Selah Surely they are disquieted in vain: He heapeth up riches , and knoweth not who shall gather them. My hope is in thee. Make me not the reproach of the foolish. Because thou didst it. I am consumed by the blow of thy hand. Thou makest his beauty to consume away like a moth: Surely every man is vanity. [Selah Hold not thy peace at my tears: For I am a stranger with thee, A sojourner, as all my fathers were. Before I go hence, and be no more.
I was dumb with silence, I held my peace, even from good;
My heart was hot within me;
Jehovah, make me to know mine end,
Behold, thou hast made my days as handbreadths;
Surely every man walketh in a vain show;
And now, Lord, what wait I for?
Deliver me from all my transgressions:
I was dumb, I opened not my mouth;
Remove thy stroke away from me:
When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity,
Hear my prayer, O Jehovah, and give ear unto my cry;
Oh spare me, that I may recover strength,

40.verse_text: I waited patiently for Jehovah; And he inclined unto me, and heard my cry. And he set my feet upon a rock, and established my goings. Many shall see it, and fear, And shall trust in Jehovah. And respecteth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies. And thy thoughts which are to us-ward: They cannot be set in order unto thee; If I would declare and speak of them, They are more than can be numbered. Mine ears hast thou opened: Burnt-offering and sin-offering hast thou not required. In the roll of the book it is written of me: Yea, thy law is within my heart. Lo, I will not refrain my lips, O Jehovah, thou knowest. I have declared thy faithfulness and thy salvation; I have not concealed thy lovingkindness and thy truth from the great assembly. Let thy lovingkindness and thy truth continually preserve me. Mine iniquities have overtaken me, so that I am not able to look up; They are more than the hairs of my head; And my heart hath failed me. Make haste to help me, O Jehovah. That seek after my soul to destroy it: Let them be turned backward and brought to dishonor That delight in my hurt. That say unto me, Aha, aha. Let such as love thy salvation say continually, Jehovah be magnified. Yet the Lord thinketh upon me: Thou art my help and my deliverer; Make no tarrying, O my God.
He brought me up also out of a horrible pit, out of the miry clay;
And he hath put a new song in my mouth, even praise unto our God:
Blessed is the man that maketh Jehovah his trust,
Many, O Jehovah my God, are the wonderful works which thou hast done,
Sacrifice and offering thou hast no delight in;
Then said I, Lo, I am come;
I delight to do thy will, O my God;
I have proclaimed glad tidings of righteousness in the great assembly;
I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart;
Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O Jehovah;
For innumerable evils have compassed me about;
Be pleased, O Jehovah, to deliver me:
Let them be put to shame and confounded together
Let them be desolate by reason of their shame
Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee:
But I am poor and needy;

41.verse_text: Blessed is he that considereth the poor: Jehovah will deliver him in the day of evil. And he shall be blessed upon the earth; And deliver not thou him unto the will of his enemies. Thou makest all his bed in his sickness. Heal my soul; for I have sinned against thee. When will he die, and his name perish? His heart gathereth iniquity to itself: When he goeth abroad, he telleth it. Against me do they devise my hurt. And now that he lieth he shall rise up no more. Who did eat of my bread, Hath lifted up his heel against me. That I may requite them. Because mine enemy doth not triumph over me. And settest me before thy face for ever. From everlasting and to everlasting. Amen, and Amen.
Jehovah will preserve him, and keep him alive,
Jehovah will support him upon the couch of languishing:
I said, O Jehovah, have mercy upon me:
Mine enemies speak evil against me, saying ,
And if he come to see me , he speaketh falsehood;
All that hate me whisper together against me;
An evil disease, say they , cleaveth fast unto him;
Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted,
But thou, O Jehovah, have mercy upon me, and raise me up,
By this I know that thou delightest in me,
And as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity,
Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel,

42.verse_text: As the hart panteth after the water brooks, So panteth my soul after thee, O God. When shall I come and appear before God? While they continually say unto me, Where is thy God? How I went with the throng, and led them to the house of God, With the voice of joy and praise, a multitude keeping holyday. And why art thou disquieted within me? Hope thou in God; for I shall yet praise him For the help of his countenance. Therefore do I remember thee from the land of the Jordan, And the Hermons, from the hill Mizar. All thy waves and thy billows are gone over me. And in the night his song shall be with me, Even a prayer unto the God of my life. Why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy? While they continually say unto me, Where is thy God? And why art thou disquieted within me? Hope thou in God; for I shall yet praise him, Who is the help of my countenance, and my God.
My soul thirsteth for God, for the living God:
My tears have been my food day and night,
These things I remember, and pour out my soul within me,
Why art thou cast down, O my soul?
O my God, my soul is cast down within me:
Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of thy waterfalls:
Yet Jehovah will command his lovingkindness in the day-time;
I will say unto God my rock, Why hast thou forgotten me?
As with a sword in my bones, mine adversaries reproach me,
Why art thou cast down, O my soul?

43.verse_text: Judge me, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation: Oh deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man. Why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy? Let them bring me unto thy holy hill, And to thy tabernacles. Unto God my exceeding joy; And upon the harp will I praise thee, O God, my God. And why art thou disquieted within me? Hope thou in God; for I shall yet praise him, Who is the help of my countenance, and my God.
For thou art the God of my strength; why hast thou cast me off?
Oh send out thy light and thy truth; let them lead me:
Then will I go unto the altar of God,
Why art thou cast down, O my soul?

44.verse_text: We have heard with our ears, O God, Our fathers have told us, What work thou didst in their days, In the days of old. But them thou didst plant: Thou didst afflict the peoples; But them thou didst spread abroad. Neither did their own arm save them; But thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance, Because thou wast favorable unto them. Command deliverance for Jacob. Through thy name will we tread them under that rise up against us. Neither shall my sword save me. And hast put them to shame that hate us. And we will give thanks unto thy name for ever. [Selah And goest not forth with our hosts. And they that hate us take spoil for themselves. And hast scattered us among the nations. And hast not increased thy wealth by their price. A scoffing and a derision to them that are round about us. A shaking of the head among the peoples. And the shame of my face hath covered me, By reason of the enemy and the avenger. Neither have we dealt falsely in thy covenant. Neither have our steps declined from thy way, And covered us with the shadow of death. Or spread forth our hands to a strange god; For he knoweth the secrets of the heart. We are accounted as sheep for the slaughter. Arise, cast us not off for ever. And forgettest our affliction and our oppression? Our body cleaveth unto the earth. And redeem us for thy lovingkindness" sake.
Thou didst drive out the nations with thy hand;
For they gat not the land in possession by their own sword,
Thou art my King, O God:
Through thee will we push down our adversaries:
For I will not trust in my bow,
But thou hast saved us from our adversaries,
In God have we made our boast all the day long,
But now thou hast cast us off, and brought us to dishonor,
Thou makest us to turn back from the adversary;
Thou hast made us like sheep appointed for food,
Thou sellest thy people for nought,
Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbors,
Thou makest us a byword among the nations,
All the day long is my dishonor before me,
For the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth,
All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee,
Our heart is not turned back,
That thou hast sore broken us in the place of jackals,
If we have forgotten the name of our God,
Will not God search this out?
Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long;
Awake, why sleepest thou, O Lord?
Wherefore hidest thou thy face,
For our soul is bowed down to the dust:
Rise up for our help,

45.verse_text: My heart overfloweth with a goodly matter; I speak the things which I have made touching the king: My tongue is the pen of a ready writer. Grace is poured into thy lips: Therefore God hath blessed thee for ever. Thy glory and thy majesty. Because of truth and meekness and righteousness: And thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things. The peoples fall under thee; They are in the heart of the king"s enemies. A sceptre of equity is the sceptre of thy kingdom. Therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee With the oil of gladness above thy fellows. Out of ivory palaces stringed instruments have made thee glad. At thy right hand doth stand the queen in gold of Ophir. Forget also thine own people, and thy father"s house: For he is thy lord; and reverence thou him. The rich among the people shall entreat thy favor. Her clothing is inwrought with gold. The virgins her companions that follow her Shall be brought unto thee. They shall enter into the king"s palace. Whom thou shalt make princes in all the earth. Therefore shall the peoples give thee thanks for ever and ever.
Thou art fairer than the children of men;
Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O mighty one,
And in thy majesty ride on prosperously,
Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever:
Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated wickedness:
All thy garments smell of myrrh, and aloes, and cassia;
Kings" daughters are among thy honorable women:
Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear;
So will the king desire thy beauty;
And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift;
The king"s daughter within the palace is all glorious:
She shall be led unto the king in broidered work:
With gladness and rejoicing shall they be led:
Instead of thy fathers shall be thy children,
I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations:

46.verse_text: God is our refuge and strength, A very present help in trouble. And though the mountains be shaken into the heart of the seas; Though the mountains tremble with the swelling thereof. [Selah The holy place of the tabernacles of the Most High. God will help her, and that right early. He uttered his voice, the earth melted. The God of Jacob is our refuge. [Selah What desolations he hath made in the earth. He breaketh the bow, and cutteth the spear in sunder; He burneth the chariots in the fire. I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth. The God of Jacob is our refuge. [Selah
Therefore will we not fear, though the earth do change,
Though the waters thereof roar and be troubled,
There is a river, the streams whereof make glad the city of God,
God is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved:
The nations raged, the kingdoms were moved:
Jehovah of hosts is with us;
Come, behold the works of Jehovah,
He maketh wars to cease unto the end of the earth;
Be still, and know that I am God:
Jehovah of hosts is with us;

47.verse_text: Oh clap your hands, all ye peoples; Shout unto God with the voice of triumph. He is a great King over all the earth. And nations under our feet. The glory of Jacob whom he loved. [Selah Jehovah with the sound of a trumpet. Sing praises unto our King, sing praises. Sing ye praises with understanding. God sitteth upon his holy throne. To be the people of the God of Abraham; For the shields of the earth belong unto God: He is greatly exalted.
For Jehovah Most High is terrible;
He chooseth our inheritance for us,
God is gone up with a shout,
Sing praises to God, sing praises:
For God is the King of all the earth:
The princes of the peoples are gathered together

48.verse_text: Great is Jehovah, and greatly to be praised, In the city of our God, in his holy mountain. Is mount Zion, on the sides of the north, The city of the great King. They passed by together. They were dismayed, they hasted away. Pain, as of a woman in travail. Thou breakest the ships of Tarshish. In the city of Jehovah of hosts, in the city of our God: God will establish it for ever. [Selah In the midst of thy temple. So is thy praise unto the ends of the earth: Thy right hand is full of righteousness. Let the daughters of Judah rejoice, Because of thy judgments. Number the towers thereof; Consider her palaces: That ye may tell it to the generation following. He will be our guide even unto death.
Beautiful in elevation, the joy of the whole earth,
God hath made himself known in her palaces for a refuge.
For, lo, the kings assembled themselves,
They saw it, then were they amazed;
Trembling took hold of them there,
As we have heard, so have we seen
We have thought on thy lovingkindness, O God,
As is thy name, O God,
Walk about Zion, and go round about her;
For this God is our God for ever and ever:

49.verse_text: Hear this, all ye peoples; Give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world, Rich and poor together. And the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding. I will open my dark saying upon the harp. When iniquity at my heels compasseth me about? And boast themselves in the multitude of their riches; Nor give to God a ransom for him And it faileth for ever), That he should not see corruption. The fool and the brutish alike perish, And leave their wealth to others. And their dwelling-places to all generations; They call their lands after their own names. He is like the beasts that perish. Yet after them men approve their sayings. [Selah Death shall be their shepherd: And the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; And their beauty shall be for Sheol to consume, That there be no habitation for it. For he will receive me. [Selah When the glory of his house is increased: His glory shall not descend after him. (And men praise thee, when thou doest well to thyself), They shall never see the light. Is like the beasts that perish.
Both low and high,
My mouth shall speak wisdom;
I will incline mine ear to a parable:
Wherefore should I fear in the days of evil,
They that trust in their wealth,
None of them can by any means redeem his brother,
(For the redemption of their life is costly,
That he should still live alway,
For he shall see it. Wise men die;
Their inward thought is, that their houses shall continue for ever,
But man being in honor abideth not:
This their way is their folly:
They are appointed as a flock for Sheol;
But God will redeem my soul from the power of Sheol;
Be not thou afraid when one is made rich,
For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away;
Though while he lived he blessed his soul
He shall go to the generation of his fathers;
Man that is in honor, and understandeth not,

50.verse_text: The Mighty One, God, Jehovah, hath spoken, And called the earth from the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof. God hath shined forth. A fire devoureth before him, And it is very tempestuous round about him. And to the earth, that he may judge his people: Those that have made a covenant with me by sacrifice. For God is judge himself. [Selah O Israel, and I will testify unto thee: I am God, even thy God. And thy burnt-offerings are continually before me. Nor he-goats out of thy folds. And the cattle upon a thousand hills. And the wild beasts of the field are mine. For the world is mine, and the fulness thereof. Or drink the blood of goats? And pay thy vows unto the Most High; I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me. What hast thou to do to declare my statutes, And that thou hast taken my covenant in thy mouth, And castest my words behind thee? And hast been partaker with adulterers. And thy tongue frameth deceit. Thou slanderest thine own mother"s son. Thou thoughtest that I was altogether such a one as thyself: But I will reprove thee, and set them in order before thine eyes. Lest I tear you in pieces, and there be none to deliver: And to him that ordereth his way aright Will I show the salvation of God.
Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty,
Our God cometh, and doth not keep silence:
He calleth to the heavens above,
Gather my saints together unto me,
And the heavens shall declare his righteousness;
Hear, O my people, and I will speak;
I will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices;
I will take no bullock out of thy house,
For every beast of the forest is mine,
I know all the birds of the mountains;
If I were hungry, I would not tell thee;
Will I eat the flesh of bulls,
Offer unto God the sacrifice of thanksgiving;
And call upon me in the day of trouble:
But unto the wicked God saith,
Seeing that thou hatest instruction,
When thou sawest a thief, thou consentedst with him,
Thou givest thy mouth to evil,
Thou sittest and speakest against thy brother;
These things hast thou done, and I kept silence;
Now consider this, ye that forget God,
Whoso offereth the sacrifice of thanksgiving glorifieth me;

51.verse_text: Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy lovingkindness: According to the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my transgressions. And cleanse me from my sin. And my sin is ever before me. And done that which is evil in thy sight; That thou mayest be justified when thou speakest, And be clear when thou judgest. And in sin did my mother conceive me. And in the hidden part thou wilt make me to know wisdom. Wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow. That the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice. And blot out all mine iniquities. And renew a right spirit within me. And take not thy holy Spirit from me. And uphold me with a willing spirit. And sinners shall be converted unto thee. And my tongue shall sing aloud of thy righteousness. And my mouth shall show forth thy praise. Thou hast no pleasure in burnt-offering. A broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise. Build thou the walls of Jerusalem. In burnt-offering and whole burnt-offering: Then will they offer bullocks upon thine altar.
Wash me thoroughly from mine iniquity,
Against thee, thee only, have I sinned,
Behold, I was brought forth in iniquity;
Behold, thou desirest truth in the inward parts;
Purify me with hyssop, and I shall be clean:
Make me to hear joy and gladness,
Hide thy face from my sins,
Create in me a clean heart, O God;
Cast me not away from thy presence;
Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation;
Then will I teach transgressors thy ways;
Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation;
O Lord, open thou my lips;
For thou delightest not in sacrifice; else would I give it:
The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit:
Do good in thy good pleasure unto Zion:
Then wilt thou delight in the sacrifices of righteousness,

52.verse_text: Why boastest thou thyself in mischief, O mighty man? The lovingkindness of God endureth continually. Like a sharp razor, working deceitfully. And lying rather than to speak righteousness. [Selah O thou deceitful tongue. He will take thee up, and pluck thee out of thy tent, And root thee out of the land of the living. [Selah And shall laugh at him, saying , But trusted in the abundance of his riches, And strengthened himself in his wickedness. I trust in the lovingkindness of God for ever and ever. And I will hope in thy name, for it is good, in the presence of thy saints.
Thou lovest evil more than good,
God will likewise destroy thee for ever;
The righteous also shall see it , and fear,
Lo, this is the man that made not God his strength,
But as for me, I am like a green olive-tree in the house of God:
I will give thee thanks for ever, because thou hast done it;

53.verse_text: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. Corrupt are they, and have done abominable iniquity; There is none that doeth good. To see if there were any that did understand, That did seek after God. There is none that doeth good, no, not one. Who eat up my people as they eat bread, And call not upon God? For God hath scattered the bones of him that encampeth against thee: Thou hast put them to shame, because God hath rejected them. When God bringeth back the captivity of his people, Then shall Jacob rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
God looked down from heaven upon the children of men,
Every one of them is gone back; they are together become filthy;
Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge,
There were they in great fear, where no fear was;
Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion!

54.verse_text: Save me, O God, by thy name, And judge me in thy might. Give ear to the words of my mouth. And violent men have sought after my soul: They have not set God before them. [Selah The Lord is of them that uphold my soul. Destroy thou them in thy truth. I will give thanks unto thy name, O Jehovah, for it is good. And mine eye hath seen my desire upon mine enemies.
For strangers are risen up against me,
He will requite the evil unto mine enemies:
With a freewill-offering will I sacrifice unto thee:
For he hath delivered me out of all trouble;

55.verse_text: Give ear to my prayer, O God; And hide not thyself from my supplication. I am restless in my complaint, and moan, Because of the oppression of the wicked; For they cast iniquity upon me, And in anger they persecute me. And the terrors of death are fallen upon me. And horror hath overwhelmed me. Then would I fly away, and be at rest. I would lodge in the wilderness. [Selah From the stormy wind and tempest. For I have seen violence and strife in the city. Iniquity also and mischief are in the midst of it. Oppression and guile depart not from its streets. Then I could have borne it: Neither was it he that hated me that did magnify himself against me; Then I would have hid myself from him: My companion, and my familiar friend. We walked in the house of God with the throng. Let them go down alive into Sheol; For wickedness is in their dwelling, in the midst of them. And Jehovah will save me. And he will hear my voice. For they were many that strove with me. Even he that abideth of old, [Selah The men who have no changes, And who fear not God. He hath profaned his covenant. But his heart was war: His words were softer than oil, Yet were they drawn swords. He will never suffer the righteous to be moved. Bloodthirsty and deceitful men shall not live out half their days; But I will trust in thee.
Attend unto me, and answer me:
Because of the voice of the enemy,
My heart is sore pained within me:
Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me,
And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove!
Lo, then would I wander far off,
I would haste me to a shelter
Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongue;
Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof:
Wickedness is in the midst thereof:
For it was not an enemy that reproached me;
But it was thou, a man mine equal,
We took sweet counsel together;
Let death come suddenly upon them,
As for me, I will call upon God;
Evening, and morning, and at noonday, will I complain, and moan;
He hath redeemed my soul in peace from the battle that was against me;
God will hear, and answer them,
He hath put forth his hands against such as were at peace with him:
His mouth was smooth as butter,
Cast thy burden upon Jehovah, and he will sustain thee:
But thou, O God, wilt bring them down into the pit of destruction:

56.verse_text: Be merciful unto me, O God; for man would swallow me up: All the day long he fighting oppresseth me. For they are many that fight proudly against me. I will put my trust in thee.
