In God have I put my trust, I will not be afraid; What can flesh do unto me? All their thoughts are against me for evil. They mark my steps, Even as they have waited for my soul. In anger cast down the peoples, O God. Put thou my tears into thy bottle; Are they not in thy book? This I know, that God is for me. In Jehovah (I will praise his word), What can man do unto me? I will render thank-offerings unto thee. Hast thou not delivered my feet from falling, That I may walk before God In the light of the living?
Mine enemies would swallow me up all the day long;
In God (I will praise his word),
All the day long they wrest my words:
They gather themselves together, they hide themselves,
Then shall mine enemies turn back in the day that I call:
In God (I will praise his word),
In God have I put my trust, I will not be afraid;
Thy vows are upon me, O God:
For thou hast delivered my soul from death:

57.verse_text: Be merciful unto me, O God, be merciful unto me; For my soul taketh refuge in thee: Yea, in the shadow of thy wings will I take refuge, Until these calamities be overpast. Unto God that performeth all things for me. When he that would swallow me up reproacheth; [Selah God will send forth his lovingkindness and his truth. I lie among them that are set on fire, Even the sons of men, whose teeth are spears and arrows, And their tongue a sharp sword. Let thy glory be above all the earth. My soul is bowed down: They have digged a pit before me; They are fallen into the midst thereof themselves. [Selah I will sing, yea, I will sing praises. I myself will awake right early. I will sing praises unto thee among the nations. And thy truth unto the skies. Let thy glory be above all the earth.
I will cry unto God Most High,
He will send from heaven, and save me,
Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens;
They have prepared a net for my steps;
My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed:
Awake up, my glory; awake, psaltery and harp:
I will give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the peoples:
For thy lovingkindness is great unto the heavens,
Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens;

58.verse_text: Do ye indeed in silence speak righteousness? Do ye judge uprightly, O ye sons of men? Ye weigh out the violence of your hands in the earth. They go astray as soon as they are born, speaking lies. They are like the deaf adder that stoppeth her ear, Charming never so wisely. Break out the great teeth of the young lions, O Jehovah. When he aimeth his arrows, let them be as though they were cut off. Like the untimely birth of a woman, that hath not seen the sun. He will take them away with a whirlwind, the green and the burning alike. He shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked; Verily there is a God that judgeth in the earth.
Nay, in heart ye work wickedness;
The wicked are estranged from the womb:
Their poison is like the poison of a serpent:
Which hearkeneth not to the voice of charmers,
Break their teeth, O God, in their mouth:
Let them melt away as water that runneth apace:
Let them be as a snail which melteth and passeth away,
Before your pots can feel the thorns,
The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance:
So that men shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous:

59.verse_text: Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God: Set me on high from them that rise up against me. And save me from the bloodthirsty men. The mighty gather themselves together against me: Not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O Jehovah. Awake thou to help me, and behold. Arise to visit all the nations: Be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. [Selah And go round about the city. Swords are in their lips: For who, say they , doth hear? Thou wilt have all the nations in derision. For God is my high tower. God will let me see my desire upon mine enemies. Scatter them by thy power, and bring them down, O Lord our shield. Let them even be taken in their pride, And for cursing and lying which they speak. And let them know that God ruleth in Jacob, Unto the ends of the earth. [Selah And go round about the city. And tarry all night if they be not satisfied. Yea, I will sing aloud of thy lovingkindness in the morning: For thou hast been my high tower, And a refuge in the day of my distress. For God is my high tower, the God of my mercy.
Deliver me from the workers of iniquity,
For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul;
They run and prepare themselves without my fault:
Even thou, O Jehovah God of hosts, the God of Israel,
They return at evening, they howl like a dog,
Behold, they belch out with their mouth;
But thou, O Jehovah, wilt laugh at them;
Because of his strength I will give heed unto thee;
My God with his lovingkindness will meet me:
Slay them not, lest my people forget:
For the sin of their mouth, and the words of their lips,
Consume them in wrath, consume them, so that they shall be no more:
And at evening let them return, let them howl like a dog,
They shall wander up and down for food,
But I will sing of thy strength;
Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing praises:

60.verse_text: O God thou hast cast us off, thou hast broken us down; Thou hast been angry; oh restore us again. Heal the breaches thereof; for it shaketh. Thou hast made us to drink the wine of staggering. That it may be displayed because of the truth. [Selah Save with thy right hand, and answer us. I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth. Ephraim also is the defence of my head; Judah is my sceptre. Upon Edom will I cast my shoe: Philistia, shout thou because of me. Who hath led me unto Edom? And thou goest not forth, O God, with our hosts. For vain is the help of man. For he it is that will tread down our adversaries.
Thou hast made the land to tremble; thou hast rent it:
Thou hast showed thy people hard things:
Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee,
That thy beloved may be delivered,
God hath spoken in his holiness: I will exult;
Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine;
Who will bring me into the strong city?
Hast not thou, O God, cast us off?
Give us help against the adversary;
Through God we shall do valiantly;

61.verse_text: Hear my cry, O God; Attend unto my prayer. Lead me to the rock that is higher than I. A strong tower from the enemy. I will take refuge in the covert of thy wings. [Selah Thou hast given me the heritage of those that fear thy name. His years shall be as many generations. Oh prepare lovingkindness and truth, that they may preserve him. That I may daily perform my vows.
From the end of the earth will I call unto thee, when my heart is overwhelmed:
For thou hast been a refuge for me,
I will dwell in thy tabernacle for ever:
For thou, O God, hast heard my vows:
Thou wilt prolong the king"s life;
He shall abide before God for ever:
So will I sing praise unto thy name for ever,

62.verse_text: My soul waiteth in silence for God only: From him cometh my salvation. He is my high tower; I shall not be greatly moved. That ye may slay him , all of you, Like a leaning wall, like a tottering fence? They delight in lies; They bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. [Selah For my expectation is from him. He is my high tower; I shall not be moved. The rock of my strength, and my refuge, is in God. Pour out your heart before him: God is a refuge for us. [Selah In the balances they will go up; They are together lighter than vanity. And become not vain in robbery: If riches increase, set not your heart thereon . Twice have I heard this, That power belongeth unto God. For thou renderest to every man according to his work.
He only is my rock and my salvation:
How long will ye set upon a man,
They only consult to thrust him down from his dignity;
My soul, wait thou in silence for God only;
He only is my rock and my salvation:
With God is my salvation and my glory:
Trust in him at all times, ye people;
Surely men of low degree are vanity, and men of high degree are a lie:
Also unto thee, O Lord, belongeth lovingkindness;

63.verse_text: O God, thou art my God; earnestly will I seek thee: My soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh longeth for thee, In a dry and weary land, where no water is. To see thy power and thy glory. My lips shall praise thee. I will lift up my hands in thy name. And my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips; And meditate on thee in the night-watches. And in the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice. Thy right hand upholdeth me. Shall go into the lower parts of the earth. They shall be a portion for foxes. Every one that sweareth by him shall glory; For the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped.
So have I looked upon thee in the sanctuary,
Because thy lovingkindness is better than life,
So will I bless thee while I live:
My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness;
When I remember thee upon my bed,
For thou hast been my help,
My soul followeth hard after thee:
But those that seek my soul, to destroy it,
They shall be given over to the power of the sword:
But the king shall rejoice in God:

64.verse_text: Hear my voice, O God, in my complaint: Preserve my life from fear of the enemy. From the tumult of the workers of iniquity; And have aimed their arrows, even bitter words, Suddenly do they shoot at him, and fear not. They commune of laying snares privily; They say, Who will see them? We have accomplished, say they , a diligent search: And the inward thought and the heart of every one is deep. With an arrow suddenly shall they be wounded. All that see them shall wag the head. And they shall declare the work of God, And shall wisely consider of his doing. And all the upright in heart shall glory.
Hide me from the secret counsel of evil-doers,
Who have whet their tongue like a sword,
That they may shoot in secret places at the perfect:
They encourage themselves in an evil purpose;
But God will shoot at them;
So they shall be made to stumble, their own tongue being against them:
The righteous shall be glad in Jehovah, and shall take refuge in him;

65.verse_text: Praise waiteth for thee, O God, in Zion; And unto thee shall the vow be performed. Unto thee shall all flesh come. As for our transgressions, thou wilt forgive them. That he may dwell in thy courts: We shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house, Thy holy temple. O God of our salvation, Thou that art the confidence of all the ends of the earth, And of them that are afar off upon the sea: Being girded about with might; The roaring of their waves, And the tumult of the peoples. Thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice. Thou greatly enrichest it; The river of God is full of water: Thou providest them grain, when thou hast so prepared the earth. Thou settlest the ridges thereof: Thou makest it soft with showers; Thou blessest the springing thereof. And thy paths drop fatness. And the hills are girded with joy. The valleys also are covered over with grain; They shout for joy, they also sing.
Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and causest to approach unto thee ,
By terrible things thou wilt answer us in righteousness,
Who by his strength setteth fast the mountains,
Who stilleth the roaring of the seas,
They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy tokens:
Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it,
Thou crownest the year with thy goodness;
They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness;
The pastures are clothed with flocks;

66.verse_text: Make a joyful noise unto God, all the earth: Make his praise glorious. Through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies submit themselves unto thee. And shall sing unto thee; They shall sing to thy name. [Selah He is terrible in his doing toward the children of men. They went through the river on foot: There did we rejoice in him. His eyes observe the nations: Let not the rebellious exalt themselves. [Selah And make the voice of his praise to be heard; And suffereth not our feet to be moved. Thou hast tried us, as silver is tried. Thou layedst a sore burden upon our loins. We went through fire and through water; But thou broughtest us out into a wealthy place. I will pay thee my vows, And my mouth spake, when I was in distress. With the incense of rams; I will offer bullocks with goats. [Selah And I will declare what he hath done for my soul. And he was extolled with my tongue. The Lord will not hear: He hath attended to the voice of my prayer. Who hath not turned away my prayer, Nor his lovingkindness from me.
Sing forth the glory of his name:
Say unto God, How terrible are thy works!
All the earth shall worship thee,
Come, and see the works of God;
He turned the sea into dry land;
He ruleth by his might for ever;
Oh bless our God, ye peoples,
Who holdeth our soul in life,
For thou, O God, hast proved us:
Thou broughtest us into the net;
Thou didst cause men to ride over our heads;
I will come into thy house with burnt-offerings;
Which my lips uttered,
I will offer unto thee burnt-offerings of fatlings,
Come, and hear, all ye that fear God,
I cried unto him with my mouth,
If I regard iniquity in my heart,
But verily God hath heard;
Blessed be God,

67.verse_text: God be merciful unto us, and bless us, And cause his face to shine upon us; [Selah Thy salvation among all nations. Let all the peoples praise thee. For thou wilt judge the peoples with equity, And govern the nations upon earth. [Selah Let all the peoples praise thee. God, even our own God, will bless us. And all the ends of the earth shall fear him.
That thy way may be known upon earth,
Let the peoples praise thee, O God;
Oh let the nations be glad and sing for joy;
Let the peoples praise thee, O God;
The earth hath yielded its increase:

68.verse_text: Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered; Let them also that hate him flee before him. As wax melteth before the fire, So let the wicked perish at the presence of God. Yea, let them rejoice with gladness. Cast up a highway for him that rideth through the deserts; His name is Jehovah; and exult ye before him. Is God in his holy habitation. He bringeth out the prisoners into prosperity; But the rebellious dwell in a parched land. When thou didst march through the wilderness; [Selah The heavens also dropped rain at the presence of God: Yon Sinai trembled at the presence of God, the God of Israel. Thou didst confirm thine inheritance, when it was weary. Thou, O God, didst prepare of thy goodness for the poor. The women that publish the tidings are a great host. And she that tarrieth at home divideth the spoil. It is as the wings of a dove covered with silver, And her pinions with yellow gold. It was as when it snoweth in Zalmon. A high mountain is the mountain of Bashan. At the mountain which God hath desired for his abode? Yea, Jehovah will dwell in it for ever. The Lord is among them, as in Sinai, in the sanctuary. Thou hast received gifts among men, Yea, among the rebellious also, that Jehovah God might dwell with them . Even the God who is our salvation. [Selah And unto Jehovah the Lord belongeth escape from death. The hairy scalp of such a one as goeth on still in his guiltiness. I will bring them again from the depths of the sea; That the tongue of thy dogs may have its portion from thine enemies. Even the goings of my God, my King, into the sanctuary. In the midst of the damsels playing with timbrels. Even the Lord, ye that are of the fountain of Israel. The princes of Judah and their council, The princes of Zebulun, the princes of Naphtali. Strengthen, O God, that which thou hast wrought for us. Kings shall bring presents unto thee. The multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the peoples, Trampling under foot the pieces of silver: He hath scattered the peoples that delight in war. Ethiopia shall haste to stretch out her hands unto God. Oh sing praises unto the Lord; [Selah Lo, he uttereth his voice, a mighty voice. His excellency is over Israel, And his strength is in the skies. The God of Israel, he giveth strength and power unto his people. Blessed be God.
As smoke is driven away, so drive them away:
But let the righteous be glad; let them exult before God:
Sing unto God, sing praises to his name:
A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows,
God setteth the solitary in families:
O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people,
The earth trembled,
Thou, O God, didst send a plentiful rain,
Thy congregation dwelt therein:
The Lord giveth the word:
Kings of armies flee, they flee;
When ye lie among the sheepfolds,
When the Almighty scattered kings therein,
A mountain of God is the mountain of Bashan;
Why look ye askance, ye high mountains,
The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands upon thousands:
Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led away captives;
Blessed be the Lord, who daily beareth our burden,
God is unto us a God of deliverances;
But God will smite through the head of his enemies,
The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan,
That thou mayest crush them , dipping thy foot in blood,
They have seen thy goings, O God,
The singers went before, the minstrels followed after,
Bless ye God in the congregations,
There is little Benjamin their ruler,
Thy God hath commanded thy strength:
Because of thy temple at Jerusalem
Rebuke the wild beast of the reeds,
Princes shall come out of Egypt;
Sing unto God, ye kingdoms of the earth;
To him that rideth upon the heaven of heavens, which are of old;
Ascribe ye strength unto God:
O God, thou art terrible out of thy holy places:

69.verse_text: Save me, O God; For the waters are come in unto my soul. I am come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me. Mine eyes fail while I wait for my God. They that would cut me off, being mine enemies wrongfully, are mighty: That which I took not away I have to restore. And my sins are not hid from thee. Let not those that seek thee be brought to dishonor through me, O God of Israel. Shame hath covered my face. And an alien unto my mother"s children. And the reproaches of them that reproach thee are fallen upon me. That was to my reproach. I became a byword unto them. And I am the song of the drunkards. O God, in the abundance of thy lovingkindness, Answer me in the truth of thy salvation. Let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters. Neither let the deep swallow me up; And let not the pit shut its mouth upon me. According to the multitude of thy tender mercies turn thou unto me. For I am in distress; answer me speedily. Ransom me because of mine enemies. Mine adversaries are all before thee. And I looked for some to take pity, but there was none; And for comforters, but I found none. And in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink. And when they are in peace, let it become a trap. And make their loins continually to shake. And let the fierceness of thine anger overtake them. Let none dwell in their tents. And they tell of the sorrow of those whom thou hast wounded. And let them not come into thy righteousness. And not be written with the righteous. Let thy salvation, O God, set me up on high. And will magnify him with thanksgiving. Or a bullock that hath horns and hoofs. Ye that seek after God, let your heart live. And despiseth not his prisoners. The seas, and everything that moveth therein. And they shall abide there, and have it in possession. And they that love his name shall dwell therein.
I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing:
I am weary with my crying; my throat is dried:
They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head:
O God, thou knowest my foolishness;
Let not them that wait for thee be put to shame through me, O Lord Jehovah of hosts:
Because for thy sake I have borne reproach;
I am become a stranger unto my brethren,
For the zeal of thy house hath eaten me up;
When I wept, and chastened my soul with fasting,
When I made sackcloth my clothing,
They that sit in the gate talk of me;
But as for me, my prayer is unto thee, O Jehovah, in an acceptable time:
Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink:
Let not the waterflood overwhelm me,
Answer me, O Jehovah; for thy lovingkindness is good:
And hide not thy face from thy servant;
Draw nigh unto my soul, and redeem it:
Thou knowest my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonor:
Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness:
They gave me also gall for my food;
Let their table before them become a snare;
Let their eyes be darkened, so that they cannot see;
Pour out thine indignation upon them,
Let their habitation be desolate;
For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten;
Add iniquity unto their iniquity;
Let them be blotted out of the book of life,
But I am poor and sorrowful:
I will praise the name of God with a song,
And it will please Jehovah better than an ox,
The meek have seen it, and are glad:
For Jehovah heareth the needy,
Let heaven and earth praise him,
For God will save Zion, and build the cities of Judah;
The seed also of his servants shall inherit it;

70.verse_text: Make haste , O God, to deliver me; Make haste to help me, O Jehovah. That seek after my soul: Let them be turned backward and brought to dishonor That delight in my hurt. That say, Aha, aha. And let such as love thy salvation say continually, Let God be magnified. Make haste unto me, O God: Thou art my help and my deliverer; O Jehovah, make no tarrying.
Let them be put to shame and confounded
Let them be turned back by reason of their shame
Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee;
But I am poor and needy;

71.verse_text: In thee, O Jehovah, do I take refuge: Let me never be put to shame. Bow down thine ear unto me, and save me. Thou hast given commandment to save me; For thou art my rock and my fortress. Out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man. Thou art my trust from my youth. Thou art he that took me out of my mother"s bowels: My praise shall be continually of thee. But thou art my strong refuge. And with thy honor all the day. Forsake me not when my strength faileth. And they that watch for my soul take counsel together, Pursue and take him; for there is none to deliver. O my God, make haste to help me. Let them be covered with reproach and dishonor that seek my hurt. And will praise thee yet more and more. And of thy salvation all the day; For I know not the numbers thereof . I will make mention of thy righteousness, even of thine only. And hitherto have I declared thy wondrous works. Until I have declared thy strength unto the next generation, Thy might to every one that is to come. Thou who hast done great things, O God, who is like unto thee? Wilt quicken us again, And wilt bring us up again from the depths of the earth. And turn again and comfort me. Even thy truth, O my God: Unto thee will I sing praises with the harp, O thou Holy One of Israel. And my soul, which thou hast redeemed. For they are put to shame, for they are confounded, that seek my hurt.
Deliver me in thy righteousness, and rescue me:
Be thou to me a rock of habitation, whereunto I may continually resort:
Rescue me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked,
For thou art my hope, O Lord Jehovah:
By thee have I been holden up from the womb;
I am as a wonder unto many;
My mouth shall be filled with thy praise,
Cast me not off in the time of old age;
For mine enemies speak concerning me;
Saying, God hath forsaken him:
O God, be not far from me;
Let them be put to shame and consumed that are adversaries to my soul;
But I will hope continually,
My mouth shall tell of thy righteousness,
I will come with the mighty acts of the Lord Jehovah:
O God, thou hast taught me from my youth;
Yea, even when I am old and grayheaded, O God, forsake me not,
Thy righteousness also, O God, is very high;
Thou, who hast showed us many and sore troubles,
Increase thou my greatness,
I will also praise thee with the psaltery,
My lips shall shout for joy when I sing praises unto thee;
My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long;

72.verse_text: Give the king thy judgments, O God, And thy righteousness unto the king"s son. And thy poor with justice. And the hills, in righteousness. He will save the children of the needy, And will break in pieces the oppressor. And so long as the moon, throughout all generations. As showers that water the earth. And abundance of peace, till the moon be no more. And from the River unto the ends of the earth. And his enemies shall lick the dust. The kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts. All nations shall serve him. And the poor, that hath no helper. And the souls of the needy he will save. And precious will their blood be in his sight: And men shall pray for him continually; They shall bless him all the day long. The fruit thereof shall shake like Lebanon: And they of the city shall flourish like grass of the earth. His name shall be continued as long as the sun: And men shall be blessed in him; All nations shall call him happy. Who only doeth wondrous things: And let the whole earth be filled with his glory. Amen, and Amen.
He will judge thy people with righteousness,
The mountains shall bring peace to the people,
He will judge the poor of the people,
They shall fear thee while the sun endureth,
He will come down like rain upon the mown grass,
In his days shall the righteous flourish,
He shall have dominion also from sea to sea,
They that dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him;
The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall render tribute:
Yea, all kings shall fall down before him;
For he will deliver the needy when he crieth,
He will have pity on the poor and needy,
He will redeem their soul from oppression and violence;
And they shall live; and to him shall be given of the gold of Sheba:
There shall be abundance of grain in the earth upon the top of the mountains;
His name shall endure for ever;
Blessed be Jehovah God, the God of Israel,
And blessed be his glorious name for ever;
The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.

73.verse_text: Surely God is good to Israel, Even to such as are pure in heart. My steps had well nigh slipped. When I saw the prosperity of the wicked. But their strength is firm. Neither are they plagued like other men. Violence covereth them as a garment. They have more than heart could wish. They speak loftily. And their tongue walketh through the earth. And waters of a full cup are drained by them. And is there knowledge in the Most High? And, being alway at ease, they increase in riches. And washed my hands in innocency; And chastened every morning. Behold, I had dealt treacherously with the generation of thy children. It was too painful for me; And considered their latter end. Thou castest them down to destruction. They are utterly consumed with terrors. So, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou wilt despise their image. And I was pricked in my heart: I was as a beast before thee. Thou hast holden my right hand. And afterward receive me to glory. And there is none upon earth that I desire besides thee. But God is the strength of my heart and my portion for ever. Thou hast destroyed all them that play the harlot, departing from thee. I have made the Lord Jehovah my refuge, That I may tell of all thy works.
But as for me, my feet were almost gone;
For I was envious at the arrogant,
For there are no pangs in their death;
They are not in trouble as other men;
Therefore pride is as a chain about their neck;
Their eyes stand out with fatness:
They scoff, and in wickedness utter oppression:
They have set their mouth in the heavens,
Therefore his people return hither:
And they say, How doth God know?
Behold, these are the wicked;
Surely in vain have I cleansed my heart,
For all the day long have I been plagued,
If I had said, I will speak thus;
When I thought how I might know this,
Until I went into the sanctuary of God,
Surely thou settest them in slippery places:
How are they become a desolation in a moment!
As a dream when one awaketh,
For my soul was grieved,
So brutish was I, and ignorant;
Nevertheless I am continually with thee:
Thou wilt guide me with thy counsel,
Whom have I in heaven but thee ?
My flesh and my heart faileth;
For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish:
But it is good for me to draw near unto God:

74.verse_text: O God, why hast thou cast us off for ever? Why doth thine anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture? Which thou hast redeemed to be the tribe of thine inheritance; And mount Zion, wherein thou hast dwelt. All the evil that the enemy hath done in the sanctuary. They have set up their ensigns for signs. Axes upon a thicket of trees. They break down with hatchet and hammers. They have profaned the dwelling-place of thy name by casting it to the ground. They have burned up all the synagogues of God in the land. There is no more any prophet; Neither is there among us any that knoweth how long. Shall the enemy blaspheme thy name for ever? Pluck it out of thy bosom and consume them . Working salvation in the midst of the earth. Thou brakest the heads of the sea-monsters in the waters. Thou gavest him to be food to the people inhabiting the wilderness. Thou driedst up mighty rivers. Thou hast prepared the light and the sun. Thou hast made summer and winter. And that a foolish people hath blasphemed thy name. Forget not the life of thy poor for ever. For the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of violence. Let the poor and needy praise thy name. Remember how the foolish man reproacheth thee all the day. The tumult of those that rise up against thee ascendeth continually.
Remember thy congregation, which thou hast gotten of old,
Lift up thy feet unto the perpetual ruins,
Thine adversaries have roared in the midst of thine assembly;
They seemed as men that lifted up
And now all the carved work thereof
They have set thy sanctuary on fire;
They said in their heart, Let us make havoc of them altogether:
We see not our signs:
How long, O God, shall the adversary reproach?
Why drawest thou back thy hand, even thy right hand?
Yet God is my King of old,
Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength:
Thou brakest the heads of leviathan in pieces;
Thou didst cleave fountain and flood:
The day is thine, the night also is thine:
Thou hast set all the borders of the earth:
Remember this, that the enemy hath reproached, O Jehovah,
Oh deliver not the soul of thy turtle-dove unto the wild beast:
Have respect unto the covenant;
Oh let not the oppressed return ashamed:
Arise, O God, plead thine own cause:
Forget not the voice of thine adversaries:

75.verse_text: We give thanks unto thee, O God; We give thanks, for thy name is near: Men tell of thy wondrous works. I will judge uprightly. I have set up the pillars of it. [Selah And to the wicked, Lift not up the horn: Speak not with a stiff neck. Nor yet from the south, cometh lifting up. He putteth down one, and lifteth up another. It is full of mixture, and he poureth out of the same: Surely the dregs thereof, all the wicked of the earth shall drain them, and drink them. I will sing praises to the God of Jacob. But the horns of the righteous shall be lifted up.
When I shall find the set time,
The earth and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolved:
I said unto the arrogant, Deal not arrogantly;
Lift not up your horn on high;
For neither from the east, nor from the west,
For in the hand of Jehovah there is a cup, and the wine foameth;
But I will declare for ever,
All the horns of the wicked also will I cut off;

76.verse_text: In Judah is God known: His name is great in Israel. And his dwelling-place in Zion. The shield, and the sword, and the battle. [Selah From the mountains of prey. They have slept their sleep; And none of the men of might have found their hands. Both chariot and horse are cast into a dead sleep. And who may stand in thy sight when once thou art angry? The earth feared, and was still, To save all the meek of the earth. [Selah The residue of wrath shalt thou gird upon thee. Let all that are round about him bring presents unto him that ought to be feared. He is terrible to the kings of the earth.
In Salem also is his tabernacle,
There he brake the arrows of the bow;
The stouthearted are made a spoil,
At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob,
Thou, even thou, art to be feared;
Thou didst cause sentence to be heard from heaven;
Surely the wrath of man shall praise thee:
Vow, and pay unto Jehovah your God:
He will cut off the spirit of princes:

77.verse_text: I will cry unto God with my voice, Even unto God with my voice; and he will give ear unto me. My hand was stretched out in the night, and slacked not; My soul refused to be comforted. I complain, and my spirit is overwhelmed. [Selah I am so troubled that I cannot speak. The years of ancient times. I commune with mine own heart; And my spirit maketh diligent search. And will he be favorable no more? Doth his promise fail for evermore? Hath he in anger shut up his tender mercies? [Selah But I will remember the years of the right hand of the Most High. For I will remember thy wonders of old. And muse on thy doings. Who is a great god like unto God? Thou hast made known thy strength among the peoples. The sons of Jacob and Joseph. [Selah The waters saw thee, they were afraid: The depths also trembled. The skies sent out a sound: Thine arrows also went abroad. The lightnings lightened the world: The earth trembled and shook. And thy paths in the great waters, And thy footsteps were not known. By the hand of Moses and Aaron.
In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord:
I remember God, and am disquieted:
Thou holdest mine eyes watching:
I have considered the days of old,
I call to remembrance my song in the night:
Will the Lord cast off for ever?
Is his lovingkindness clean gone for ever?
Hath God forgotten to be gracious?
And I said, This is my infirmity;
I will make mention of the deeds of Jehovah;
I will meditate also upon all thy work,
Thy way, O God, is in the sanctuary:
Thou art the God that doest wonders:
Thou hast with thine arm redeemed thy people,
The waters saw thee, O God;
The clouds poured out water;
The voice of thy thunder was in the whirlwind;
Thy way was in the sea,
Thou leddest thy people like a flock,

78.verse_text: Give ear, O my people, to my law: Incline your ears to the words of my mouth. I will utter dark sayings of old, And our fathers have told us. Telling to the generation to come the praises of Jehovah, And his strength, and his wondrous works that he hath done. And appointed a law in Israel, Which he commanded our fathers, That they should make them known to their children; Who should arise and tell them to their children, And not forget the works of God, But keep his commandments, A stubborn and rebellious generation, A generation that set not their heart aright, And whose spirit was not stedfast with God. Turned back in the day of battle. And refused to walk in his law; And his wondrous works that he had showed them. In the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan. And he made the waters to stand as a heap. And all the night with a light of fire. And gave them drink abundantly as out of the depths. And caused waters to run down like rivers. To rebel against the Most High in the desert. By asking food according to their desire. They said, Can God prepare a table in the wilderness? And streams overflowed; Can he give bread also? Will he provide flesh for his people? And a fire was kindled against Jacob, And anger also went up against Israel; And trusted not in his salvation. And opened the doors of heaven; And gave them food from heaven. He sent them food to the full. And by his power he guided the south wind. And winged birds as the sand of the seas: Round about their habitations. And he gave them their own desire. Their food was yet in their mouths, And slew of the fattest of them, And smote down the young men of Israel. And believed not in his wondrous works. And their years in terror. And they returned and sought God earnestly. And the Most High God their redeemer. And lied unto him with their tongue. Neither were they faithful in his covenant. Yea, many a time turned he his anger away, And did not stir up all his wrath. A wind that passeth away, and cometh not again. And grieve him in the desert! And provoked the Holy One of Israel. Nor the day when he redeemed them from the adversary; And his wonders in the field of Zoan, And their streams, so that they could not drink. And frogs, which destroyed them. And their labor unto the locust. And their sycomore-trees with frost. And their flocks to hot thunderbolts. Wrath, and indignation, and trouble, A band of angels of evil. He spared not their soul from death, But gave their life over to the pestilence, The chief of their strength in the tents of Ham. And guided them in the wilderness like a flock. But the sea overwhelmed their enemies. To this mountain, which his right hand had gotten. And allotted them for an inheritance by line, And made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents. And kept not his testimonies; They were turned aside like a deceitful bow. And moved him to jealousy with their graven images. And greatly abhorred Israel; The tent which he placed among men; And his glory into the adversary"s hand. And was wroth with his inheritance. And their virgins had no marriage-song. And their widows made no lamentation. Like a mighty man that shouteth by reason of wine. He put them to a perpetual reproach. And chose not the tribe of Ephraim, The mount Zion which he loved. Like the earth which he hath established for ever. And took him from the sheepfolds: To be the shepherd of Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance. And guided them by the skilfulness of his hands.
I will open my mouth in a parable;
Which we have heard and known,
We will not hide them from their children,
For he established a testimony in Jacob,
That the generation to come might know them , even the children that should be born;
That they might set their hope in God,
And might not be as their fathers,
The children of Ephraim, being armed and carrying bows,
They kept not the covenant of God,
And they forgat his doings,
Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers,
He clave the sea, and caused them to pass through;
In the day-time also he led them with a cloud,
He clave rocks in the wilderness,
He brought streams also out of the rock,
Yet went they on still to sin against him,
And they tempted God in their heart
Yea, they spake against God;
Behold, he smote the rock, so that waters gushed out,
Therefore Jehovah heard, and was wroth;
Because they believed not in God,
Yet he commanded the skies above,
And he rained down manna upon them to eat,
Man did eat the bread of the mighty:
He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens;
He rained flesh also upon them as the dust,
And he let it fall in the midst of their camp,
So they did eat, and were well filled;
They were not estranged from that which they desired,
When the anger of God went up against them,
For all this they sinned still,
Therefore their days did he consume in vanity,
When he slew them, then they inquired after him;
And they remembered that God was their rock,
But they flattered him with their mouth,
For their heart was not right with him,
But he, being merciful, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not:
And he remembered that they were but flesh,
How oft did they rebel against him in the wilderness,
And they turned again and tempted God,
They remembered not his hand,
How he set his signs in Egypt,
And turned their rivers into blood,
He sent among them swarms of flies, which devoured them;
He gave also their increase unto the caterpillar,
He destroyed their vines with hail,
He gave over their cattle also to the hail,
He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger,
He made a path for his anger;
And smote all the first-born in Egypt,
But he led forth his own people like sheep,
And he led them safely, so that they feared not;
And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary,
He drove out the nations also before them,
Yet they tempted and rebelled against the Most High God,
But turned back, and dealt treacherously like their fathers:
For they provoked him to anger with their high places,
When God heard this , he was wroth,
So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh,
And delivered his strength into captivity,
He gave his people over also unto the sword,
Fire devoured their young men;
Their priests fell by the sword;
Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep,
And he smote his adversaries backward:
Moreover he refused the tent of Joseph,
But chose the tribe of Judah,
And he built his sanctuary like the heights,
He chose David also his servant,
From following the ewes that have their young he brought him,
So he was their shepherd according to the integrity of his heart,

79.verse_text: O God, the nations are come into thine inheritance; Thy holy temple have they defiled; They have laid Jerusalem in heaps. The flesh of thy saints unto the beasts of the earth. And there was none to bury them. A scoffing and derision to them that are round about us. Shall thy jealousy burn like fire? And upon the kingdoms that call not upon thy name. And laid waste his habitation. Let thy tender mercies speedily meet us; For we are brought very low. And deliver us, and forgive our sins, for thy name"s sake. Let the avenging of the blood of thy servants which is shed Be known among the nations in our sight. According to the greatness of thy power preserve thou those that are appointed to death; Their reproach, wherewith they have reproached thee, O Lord. Will give thee thanks for ever: We will show forth thy praise to all generations.
The dead bodies of thy servants have they given to be food unto the birds of the heavens,
Their blood have they shed like water round about Jerusalem;
We are become a reproach to our neighbors,
How long, O Jehovah? wilt thou be angry for ever?
Pour out thy wrath upon the nations that know thee not,
Remember not against us the iniquities of our forefathers:
Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy name;
Wherefore should the nations say, Where is their God?
Let the sighing of the prisoner come before thee:
And render unto our neighbors sevenfold into their bosom
So we thy people and sheep of thy pasture

80.verse_text: Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, Thou that leadest Joseph like a flock; Thou that sittest above the cherubim, shine forth. And come to save us. And cause thy face to shine, and we shall be saved. How long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy people? And given them tears to drink in large measure. And our enemies laugh among themselves. And cause thy face to shine, and we shall be saved. Thou didst drive out the nations, and plantedst it. And it took deep root, and filled the land. And the boughs thereof were like cedars of God. And its shoots unto the River. So that all they that pass by the way do pluck it? And the wild beasts of the field feed on it. Look down from heaven, and behold, and visit this vine, And the branch that thou madest strong for thyself. They perish at the rebuke of thy countenance. Upon the son of man whom thou madest strong for thyself. Quicken thou us, and we will call upon thy name. Cause thy face to shine, and we shall be saved.
Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh, stir up thy might,
Thou hast fed them with the bread of tears,
Thou makest us a strife unto our neighbors;
Turn us again, O God of hosts;
Thou broughtest a vine out of Egypt:
The mountains were covered with the shadow of it,
It sent out its branches unto the sea,
Why hast thou broken down its walls,
The boar out of the wood doth ravage it,
Turn again, we beseech thee, O God of hosts:
And the stock which thy right hand planted,
It is burned with fire, it is cut down:
Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand,
So shall we not go back from thee:
Turn us again, O Jehovah God of hosts;

81.verse_text: Sing aloud unto God our strength: Make a joyful noise unto the God of Jacob. The pleasant harp with the psaltery. At the full moon, on our feast-day. An ordinance of the God of Jacob. When he went out over the land of Egypt, Where I heard a language that I knew not. His hands were freed from the basket. I answered thee in the secret place of thunder; I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. [Selah O Israel, if thou wouldest hearken unto me! Neither shalt thou worship any foreign god. Who brought thee up out of the land of Egypt: Open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it. And Israel would none of me. That they might walk in their own counsels. That Israel would walk in my ways! And turn my hand against their adversaries. But their time should endure for ever. And with honey out of the rock would I satisfy thee.
Raise a song, and bring hither the timbrel,
Blow the trumpet at the new moon,
For it is a statute for Israel,
He appointed it in Joseph for a testimony,
I removed his shoulder from the burden:
Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee;
Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee:
There shall no strange god be in thee;
But my people hearkened not to my voice;
So I let them go after the stubbornness of their heart,
Oh that my people would hearken unto me,
I would soon subdue their enemies,
The haters of Jehovah should submit themselves unto him:
He would feed them also with the finest of the wheat;

82.verse_text: God standeth in the congregation of God; He judgeth among the gods. And respect the persons of the wicked? [Selah Do justice to the afflicted and destitute. Deliver them out of the hand of the wicked. They walk to and fro in darkness: All the foundations of the earth are shaken. And all of you sons of the Most High. And fall like one of the princes. For thou shalt inherit all the nations.
How long will ye judge unjustly,
They know not, neither do they understand;
Nevertheless ye shall die like men,
Arise, O God, judge the earth;

83.verse_text: O God, keep not thou silence: Hold not thy peace, and be not still, O God. And they that hate thee have lifted up the head. And consult together against thy hidden ones. That the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance. Against thee do they make a covenant: Moab, and the Hagarenes; Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre: They have helped the children of Lot. [Selah As to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the river Kishon; Who became as dung for the earth. Yea, all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna; The habitations of God. As stubble before the wind. And as the flame that setteth the mountains on fire, And terrify them with thy storm. That they may seek thy name, O Jehovah. Yea, let them be confounded and perish; Art the Most High over all the earth.
For, lo, thine enemies make a tumult;
They take crafty counsel against thy people,
They have said, Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation;
For they have consulted together with one consent;
The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites;
Assyria also is joined with them;
Do thou unto them as unto Midian,
Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb;
Who said, Let us take to ourselves in possession
O my God, make them like the whirling dust;
As the fire that burneth the forest,
So pursue them with thy tempest,
Let them be put to shame and dismayed for ever;
That they may know that thou alone, whose name is Jehovah,

84.verse_text: How amiable are thy tabernacles, O Jehovah of hosts! My heart and my flesh cry out unto the living God. And the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, Even thine altars, O Jehovah of hosts, My King, and my God. They will be still praising thee. [Selah In whose heart are the highways to Zion . Yea, the early rain covereth it with blessings. Every one of them appeareth before God in Zion. Give ear, O God of Jacob. [Selah And look upon the face of thine anointed. I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, Than to dwell in the tents of wickedness. Jehovah will give grace and glory; No good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly. Blessed is the man that trusteth in thee.
My soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the courts of Jehovah;
Yea, the sparrow hath found her a house,
Blessed are they that dwell in thy house:
Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee;
Passing through the valley of Weeping they make it a place of springs;
They go from strength to strength;
O Jehovah God of hosts, hear my prayer;
For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand.
For Jehovah God is a sun and a shield:

85.verse_text: Jehovah, thou hast been favorable unto thy land; Thou hast brought back the captivity of Jacob. Thou hast covered all their sin. [Selah Thou hast turned thyself from the fierceness of thine anger. And cause thine indignation toward us to cease. Wilt thou draw out thine anger to all generations? That thy people may rejoice in thee? And grant us thy salvation. For he will speak peace unto his people, and to his saints: But let them not turn again to folly. That glory may dwell in our land. Righteousness and peace have kissed each other. And righteousness hath looked down from heaven. And our land shall yield its increase. And shall make his footsteps a way to walk in .
Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people;
Thou hast taken away all thy wrath;
Turn us, O God of our salvation,
Wilt thou be angry with us for ever?
Wilt thou not quicken us again,
Show us thy lovingkindness, O Jehovah,
I will hear what God Jehovah will speak;
Surely his salvation is nigh them that fear him,
Mercy and truth are met together;
Truth springeth out of the earth;
Yea, Jehovah will give that which is good;

86.verse_text: Bow down thine ear, O Jehovah, and answer me; For I am poor and needy. O thou my God, save thy servant that trusteth in thee. For unto thee do I cry all the day long. For unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul. And abundant in lovingkindness unto all them that call upon thee. And hearken unto the voice of my supplications. For thou wilt answer me. Neither are there any works like unto thy works. And they shall glorify thy name. Thou art God alone. Unite my heart to fear thy name. And I will glorify thy name for evermore. And thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest Sheol. And a company of violent men have sought after my soul, And have not set thee before them. Slow to anger, and abundant in lovingkindness and truth. Give thy strength unto thy servant, And save the son of thy handmaid. That they who hate me may see it, and be put to shame, Because thou, Jehovah, hast helped me, and comforted me.
Preserve my soul; for I am godly:
Be merciful unto me, O Lord;
Rejoice the soul of thy servant;
For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive,
Give ear, O Jehovah, unto my prayer;
In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee;
There is none like unto thee among the gods, O Lord;
All nations whom thou hast made shall come and worship before thee, O Lord;
For thou art great, and doest wondrous things:
Teach me thy way, O Jehovah; I will walk in thy truth:
I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with my whole heart;
For great is thy lovingkindness toward me;
O God, the proud are risen up against me,
But thou, O Lord, art a God merciful and gracious,
Oh turn unto me, and have mercy upon me;
Show me a token for good,

87.verse_text: His foundation is in the holy mountains. More than all the dwellings of Jacob. O city of God. [Selah Behold, Philistia, and Tyre, with Ethiopia: This one was born there. And the Most High himself will establish her. This one was born there. [Selah All my fountains are in thee.
Jehovah loveth the gates of Zion
Glorious things are spoken of thee,
I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon as among them that know me:
Yea, of Zion it shall be said, This one and that one was born in her;
Jehovah will count, when he writeth up the peoples,
They that sing as well as they that dance shall say ,

88.verse_text: O Jehovah, the God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before thee. Incline thine ear unto my cry. And my life draweth nigh unto Sheol. I am as a man that hath no help, Like the slain that lie in the grave, Whom thou rememberest no more, And they are cut off from thy hand. In dark places, in the deeps. And thou hast afflicted me with all thy waves. [Selah Thou hast made me an abomination unto them: I am shut up, and I cannot come forth. I have called daily upon thee, O Jehovah; I have spread forth my hands unto thee. Shall they that are deceased arise and praise thee? [Selah Or thy faithfulness in Destruction? And thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness? And in the morning shall my prayer come before thee. Why hidest thou thy face from me? While I suffer thy terrors I am distracted. Thy terrors have cut me off. They compassed me about together. And mine acquaintance into darkness.
Let my prayer enter into thy presence;
For my soul is full of troubles,
I am reckoned with them that go down into the pit;
Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit,
Thy wrath lieth hard upon me,
Thou hast put mine acquaintance far from me;
Mine eye wasteth away by reason of affliction:
Wilt thou show wonders to the dead?
Shall thy lovingkindness be declared in the grave?
Shall thy wonders be known in the dark?
But unto thee, O Jehovah, have I cried;
Jehovah, why castest thou off my soul?
I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up:
Thy fierce wrath is gone over me;
They came round about me like water all the day long;
Lover and friend hast thou put far from me,

89.verse_text: I will sing of the lovingkindness of Jehovah for ever: With my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations. Thy faithfulness wilt thou establish in the very heavens. I have sworn unto David my servant: And build up thy throne to all generations. [Selah Thy faithfulness also in the assembly of the holy ones. Who among the sons of the mighty is like unto Jehovah, And to be feared above all them that are round about him? Who is a mighty one, like unto thee, O Jehovah? And thy faithfulness is round about thee. When the waves thereof arise, thou stillest them. Thou hast scattered thine enemies with the arm of thy strength. The world and the fulness thereof, thou hast founded them. Tabor and Hermon rejoice in thy name. Strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand. Lovingkindness and truth go before thy face. They walk, O Jehovah, in the light of thy countenance. And in thy righteousness are they exalted. And in thy favor our horn shall be exalted. And our king to the Holy One of Israel. And saidst, I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people. With my holy oil have I anointed him: Mine arm also shall strengthen him. Nor the son of wickedness afflict him. And smite them that hate him. And in my name shall his horn be exalted. And his right hand on the rivers. My God, and the rock of my salvation. The highest of the kings of the earth. And my covenant shall stand fast with him. And his throne as the days of heaven. And walk not in mine ordinances; And keep not my commandments; And their iniquity with stripes. Nor suffer my faithfulness to fail. Nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips. I will not lie unto David: And his throne as the sun before me. And as the faithful witness in the sky. [Selah Thou hast been wroth with thine anointed. Thou hast profaned his crown by casting it to the ground. Thou hast brought his strongholds to ruin. He is become a reproach to his neighbors. Thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice. And hast not made him to stand in the battle. And cast his throne down to the ground. Thou hast covered him with shame. [Selah How long shall thy wrath burn like fire? For what vanity hast thou created all the children of men! That shall deliver his soul from the power of Sheol? [Selah Which thou swarest unto David in thy faithfulness? How I do bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty peoples, Wherewith they have reproached the footsteps of thine anointed. Amen, and Amen.
For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever;
I have made a covenant with my chosen,
Thy seed will I establish for ever,
And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O Jehovah;
For who in the skies can be compared unto Jehovah?
A God very terrible in the council of the holy ones,
O Jehovah God of hosts,
Thou rulest the pride of the sea:
Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain;
The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine:
The north and the south, thou hast created them:
Thou hast a mighty arm;
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of thy throne:
Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound:
In thy name do they rejoice all the day;
For thou art the glory of their strength;
For our shield belongeth unto Jehovah;
Then thou spakest in vision to thy saints,
I have found David my servant;
With whom my hand shall be established;
The enemy shall not exact from him,
And I will beat down his adversaries before him,
But my faithfulness and my lovingkindness shall be with him;
I will set his hand also on the sea,
He shall cry unto me, Thou art my Father,
I also will make him my first-born,
My lovingkindness will I keep for him for evermore;
His seed also will I make to endure for ever,
If his children forsake my law,
If they break my statutes,
Then will I visit their transgression with the rod,
But my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him,
My covenant will I not break,
Once have I sworn by my holiness:
His seed shall endure for ever,
It shall be established for ever as the moon,
But thou hast cast off and rejected,
Thou hast abhorred the covenant of thy servant:
Thou hast broken down all his hedges;
All that pass by the way rob him:
Thou hast exalted the right hand of his adversaries;
Yea, thou turnest back the edge of his sword,
Thou hast made his brightness to cease,
The days of his youth hast thou shortened:
How long, O Jehovah? wilt thou hide thyself for ever?
Oh remember how short my time is:
What man is he that shall live and not see death,
Lord, where are thy former lovingkindnesses,
Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants;
Wherewith thine enemies have reproached, O Jehovah,
Blessed be Jehovah for evermore.

90.verse_text: Lord, thou hast been our dwelling-place In all generations. Or ever thou hadst formed the earth and the world, Even from everlasting to everlasting, thou art God. And sayest, Return, ye children of men. Are but as yesterday when it is past, And as a watch in the night. In the morning they are like grass which groweth up. In the evening it is cut down, and withereth. And in thy wrath are we troubled. Our secret sins in the light of thy countenance. We bring our years to an end as a sigh. Or even by reason of strength fourscore years; Yet is their pride but labor and sorrow; For it is soon gone, and we fly away. And thy wrath according to the fear that is due unto thee? That we may get us a heart of wisdom. And let it repent thee concerning thy servants. That we may rejoice and be glad all our days. And the years wherein we have seen evil. And thy glory upon their children. And establish thou the work of our hands upon us; Yea, the work of our hands establish thou it.
Before the mountains were brought forth,
For a thousand years in thy sight
Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep:
In the morning it flourisheth, and groweth up;
For we are consumed in thine anger,
Thou hast set our iniquities before thee,
For all our days are passed away in thy wrath:
The days of our years are threescore years and ten,
Who knoweth the power of thine anger,
So teach us to number our days,
Oh satisfy us in the morning with thy lovingkindness,
Make us glad according to the days wherein thou hast afflicted us,
Let thy work appear unto thy servants,
And let the favor of the Lord our God be upon us;

91.verse_text: He that dwelleth in the secret place of the Most High Shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty. My God, in whom I trust. And from the deadly pestilence. And under his wings shalt thou take refuge: His truth is a shield and a buckler. Nor for the arrow that flieth by day; Nor for the destruction that wasteth at noonday. And ten thousand at thy right hand; But it shall not come nigh thee. And see the reward of the wicked. Thou hast made the Most High thy habitation; Neither shall any plague come nigh thy tent. To keep thee in all thy ways. Lest thou dash thy foot against a stone. The young lion and the serpent shalt thou trample under foot. I will set him on high, because he hath known my name. I will be with him in trouble: I will deliver him, and honor him. And show him my salvation.
I will say of Jehovah, He is my refuge and my fortress;
For he will deliver thee from the snare of the fowler,
He will cover thee with his pinions,
Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night,
For the pestilence that walketh in darkness,
A thousand shall fall at thy side,
Only with thine eyes shalt thou behold,
For thou, O Jehovah, art my refuge!
There shall no evil befall thee,
For he will give his angels charge over thee,
They shall bear thee up in their hands,
Thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder:
Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him:
He shall call upon me, and I will answer him;
With long life will I satisfy him,

92.verse_text: It is a good thing to give thanks unto Jehovah, And to sing praises unto thy name, O Most High; And thy faithfulness every night, With a solemn sound upon the harp. I will triumph in the works of thy hands. Thy thoughts are very deep. Neither doth a fool understand this: And when all the workers of iniquity do flourish; It is that they shall be destroyed for ever. For, lo, thine enemies shall perish; All the workers of iniquity shall be scattered. I am anointed with fresh oil. Mine ears have heard my desire of the evil-doers that rise up against me. He shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon. They shall flourish in the courts of our God. They shall be full of sap and green: He is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
To show forth thy lovingkindness in the morning,
With an instrument of ten strings, and with the psaltery;
For thou, Jehovah, hast made me glad through thy work:
How great are thy works, O Jehovah!
When the wicked spring as the grass,
But thou, O Jehovah, art on high for evermore.
For, lo, thine enemies, O Jehovah,
But my horn hast thou exalted like the horn of the wild-ox:
Mine eye also hath seen my desire on mine enemies,
The righteous shall flourish like the palm-tree:
They are planted in the house of Jehovah;
They shall still bring forth fruit in old age;
To show that Jehovah is upright;

93.verse_text: Jehovah reigneth; he is clothed with majesty; Jehovah is clothed with strength; he hath girded himself therewith: The world also is established, that it cannot be moved. Thou art from everlasting. The floods have lifted up their voice; The floods lift up their waves. The mighty breakers of the sea, Jehovah on high is mighty. Holiness becometh thy house, O Jehovah, for evermore.
Thy throne is established of old:
The floods have lifted up, O Jehovah,
Above the voices of many waters,

94.verse_text: O Jehovah, thou God to whom vengeance belongeth, Thou God to whom vengeance belongeth, shine forth. Render to the proud their desert. How long shall the wicked triumph? All the workers of iniquity boast themselves. And afflict thy heritage. And murder the fatherless. Neither will the God of Jacob consider. And ye fools, when will ye be wise? He that formed the eye, shall he not see? Even he that teacheth man knowledge? That they are vanity. And teachest out of thy law; Until the pit be digged for the wicked. Neither will he forsake his inheritance. And all the upright in heart shall follow it. Who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity? My soul had soon dwelt in silence. Thy lovingkindness, O Jehovah, held me up. Thy comforts delight my soul. Which frameth mischief by statute? And condemn the innocent blood. And my God the rock of my refuge. And will cut them off in their own wickedness; Jehovah our God will cut them off.
Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth:
Jehovah, how long shall the wicked,
They prate, they speak arrogantly:
They break in pieces thy people, O Jehovah,
They slay the widow and the sojourner,
And they say, Jehovah will not see,
Consider, ye brutish among the people;
He that planted the ear, shall he not hear?
He that chastiseth the nations, shall not he correct,
Jehovah knoweth the thoughts of man,
Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O Jehovah,
That thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity,
For Jehovah will not cast off his people,
For judgment shall return unto righteousness;
Who will rise up for me against the evil-doers?
Unless Jehovah had been my help,
When I said, My foot slippeth;
In the multitude of my thoughts within me
Shall the throne of wickedness have fellowship with thee,
They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous,
But Jehovah hath been my high tower,
And he hath brought upon them their own iniquity,

95.verse_text: Oh come, let us sing unto Jehovah; Let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation. Let us make a joyful noise unto him with psalms. And a great King above all gods. The heights of the mountains are his also. And his hands formed the dry land. Let us kneel before Jehovah our Maker: And we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand. To-day, oh that ye would hear his voice! As in the day of Massah in the wilderness; Proved me, and saw my work. And said, It is a people that do err in their heart, And they have not known my ways: That they should not enter into my rest.
Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving;
For Jehovah is a great God,
In his hand are the deep places of the earth;
The sea is his, and he made it;
Oh come, let us worship and bow down;
Harden not your heart, as at Meribah,
Forty years long was I grieved with that generation,
Wherefore I sware in my wrath,

96.verse_text: Oh sing unto Jehovah a new song: Sing unto Jehovah, all the earth. Show forth his salvation from day to day. His marvellous works among all the peoples. He is to be feared above all gods. But Jehovah made the heavens. Strength and beauty are in his sanctuary. Ascribe unto Jehovah glory and strength. Bring an offering, and come into his courts. Tremble before him, all the earth. The world also is established that it cannot be moved: He will judge the peoples with equity. Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof; Then shall all the trees of the wood sing for joy For he cometh to judge the earth: He will judge the world with righteousness, And the peoples with his truth.
Sing unto Jehovah, bless his name;
Declare his glory among the nations,
For great is Jehovah, and greatly to be praised:
For all the gods of the peoples are idols;
Honor and majesty are before him:
Ascribe unto Jehovah, ye kindreds of the peoples,
Ascribe unto Jehovah the glory due unto his name:
Oh worship Jehovah in holy array:
Say among the nations, Jehovah reigneth:
Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice;
Let the field exult, and all that is therein;

97.verse_text: Jehovah reigneth; let the earth rejoice; Let the multitude of isles be glad. Righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne. And burneth up his adversaries round about. The earth saw, and trembled. At the presence of the Lord of the whole earth. And all the peoples have seen his glory. That boast themselves of idols: Worship him, all ye gods. And the daughters of Judah rejoiced, Because of thy judgments, O Jehovah. Thou art exalted far above all gods. He preserveth the souls of his saints; He delivereth them out of the hand of the wicked. And gladness for the upright in heart. And give thanks to his holy memorial name .
Clouds and darkness are round about him:
The mountains melted like wax at the presence of Jehovah,
Let all them be put to shame that serve graven images,
For thou, Jehovah, art most high above all the earth:
O ye that love Jehovah, hate evil:
Light is sown for the righteous,
Be glad in Jehovah, ye righteous;

98.verse_text: Oh sing unto Jehovah a new song; For he hath done marvellous things: His right hand, and his holy arm, hath wrought salvation for him. His righteousness hath he openly showed in the sight of the nations. All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God. Break forth and sing for joy, yea, sing praises. With the harp and the voice of melody. Make a joyful noise before the King, Jehovah. The world, and they that dwell therein; Let the hills sing for joy together He will judge the world with righteousness, And the peoples with equity.
Jehovah hath made known his salvation:
He hath remembered his lovingkindness and his faithfulness toward the house of Israel:
Make a joyful noise unto Jehovah, all the earth:
Sing praises unto Jehovah with the harp;
With trumpets and sound of cornet
Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof;
Let the floods clap their hands;
Before Jehovah; for he cometh to judge the earth:

99.verse_text: Jehovah reigneth; let the peoples tremble: He sitteth above the cherubim; let the earth be moved. And he is high above all the peoples. Holy is he. Thou dost establish equity; Thou executest justice and righteousness in Jacob. And worship at his footstool: Holy is he. And Samuel among them that call upon his name; They called upon Jehovah, and he answered them. They kept his testimonies, And the statute that he gave them. Thou wast a God that forgavest them, Though thou tookest vengeance of their doings. And worship at his holy hill; For Jehovah our God is holy.
Let them praise thy great and terrible name:
The king"s strength also loveth justice;
Moses and Aaron among his priests,
He spake unto them in the pillar of cloud:
Thou answeredst them, O Jehovah our God:

100.verse_text: Make a joyful noise unto Jehovah, all ye lands. Come before his presence with singing. It is he that hath made us, and we are his; We are his people, and the sheep of his pasture. And into his courts with praise: Give thanks unto him, and bless his name. And his faithfulness unto all generations.
Know ye that Jehovah, he is God:
Enter into his gates with thanksgiving,
For Jehovah is good; his lovingkindness endureth for ever,

101.verse_text: I will sing of lovingkindness and justice: Unto thee, O Jehovah, will I sing praises. Oh when wilt thou come unto me? I will walk within my house with a perfect heart. I hate the work of them that turn aside; It shall not cleave unto me. I will know no evil thing. Him that hath a high look and a proud heart will I not suffer. He that walketh in a perfect way, he shall minister unto me. He that speaketh falsehood shall not be established before mine eyes. To cut off all the workers of iniquity from the city of Jehovah.
I will behave myself wisely in a perfect way:
I will set no base thing before mine eyes:
A perverse heart shall depart from me:
Whoso privily slandereth his neighbor, him will I destroy:
Mine eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me:
He that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my house:
Morning by morning will I destroy all the wicked of the land;

102.verse_text: Hear my prayer, O Jehovah, And let my cry come unto thee. Incline thine ear unto me; In the day when I call answer me speedily. And my bones are burned as a firebrand. For I forget to eat my bread. My bones cleave to my flesh. I am become as an owl of the waste places. That is alone upon the house-top. They that are mad against me do curse by me. And mingled my drink with weeping, For thou hast taken me up, and cast me away. And I am withered like grass. And thy memorial name unto all generations. For it is time to have pity upon her, Yea, the set time is come. And have pity upon her dust. And all the kings of the earth thy glory. He hath appeared in his glory. And hath not despised their prayer. And a people which shall be created shall praise Jehovah. From heaven did Jehovah behold the earth; To loose those that are appointed to death; And his praise in Jerusalem; And the kingdoms, to serve Jehovah. He shortened my days. Thy years are throughout all generations. And the heavens are the work of thy hands. Yea, all of them shall wax old like a garment; As a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed: And thy years shall have no end. And their seed shall be established before thee.
Hide not thy face from me in the day of my distress:
For my days consume away like smoke,
My heart is smitten like grass, and withered;
By reason of the voice of my groaning
I am like a pelican of the wilderness;
I watch, and am become like a sparrow
Mine enemies reproach me all the day;
For I have eaten ashes like bread,
Because of thine indignation and thy wrath:
My days are like a shadow that declineth;
But thou, O Jehovah, wilt abide for ever;
Thou wilt arise, and have mercy upon Zion;
For thy servants take pleasure in her stones,
So the nations shall fear the name of Jehovah,
For Jehovah hath built up Zion;
He hath regarded the prayer of the destitute,
This shall be written for the generation to come;
For he hath looked down from the height of his sanctuary;
To hear the sighing of the prisoner;
That men may declare the name of Jehovah in Zion,
When the peoples are gathered together,
He weakened my strength in the way;
I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days:
Of old didst thou lay the foundation of the earth;
They shall perish, but thou shalt endure;
But thou art the same,
The children of thy servants shall continue,

103.verse_text: Bless Jehovah, O my soul; And all that is within me, bless his holy name. And forget not all his benefits: Who healeth all thy diseases; Who crowneth thee with lovingkindness and tender mercies; So that thy youth is renewed like the eagle. And judgments for all that are oppressed. His doings unto the children of Israel. Slow to anger, and abundant in lovingkindness. Neither will he keep his anger for ever. Nor rewarded us after our iniquities. So great is his lovingkindness toward them that fear him. So far hath he removed our transgressions from us. So Jehovah pitieth them that fear him. He remembereth that we are dust. As a flower of the field, so he flourisheth. And the place thereof shall know it no more. And his righteousness unto children"s children; And to those that remember his precepts to do them. And his kingdom ruleth over all. That are mighty in strength, that fulfil his word, Hearkening unto the voice of his word. Ye ministers of his, that do his pleasure. In all places of his dominion: Bless Jehovah, O my soul.
Bless Jehovah, O my soul,
Who forgiveth all thine iniquities;
Who redeemeth thy life from destruction;
Who satisfieth thy desire with good things,
Jehovah executeth righteous acts,
He made known his ways unto Moses,
Jehovah is merciful and gracious,
He will not always chide;
He hath not dealt with us after our sins,
For as the heavens are high above the earth,
As far as the east is from the west,
Like as a father pitieth his children,
For he knoweth our frame;
As for man, his days are as grass;
For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone;
But the lovingkindness of Jehovah is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear him,
To such as keep his covenant,
Jehovah hath established his throne in the heavens;
Bless Jehovah, ye his angels,
Bless Jehovah, all ye his hosts,
Bless Jehovah, all ye his works,

104.verse_text: Bless Jehovah, O my soul. O Jehovah my God, thou art very great; Thou art clothed with honor and majesty: Who stretchest out the heavens like a curtain; Who maketh the clouds his chariot; Who walketh upon the wings of the wind; Flames of fire his ministers; That it should not be moved for ever. The waters stood above the mountains. At the voice of thy thunder they hasted away Unto the place which thou hadst founded for them. That they turn not again to cover the earth. They run among the mountains; The wild asses quench their thirst. They sing among the branches. The earth is filled with the fruit of thy works. And herb for the service of man; That he may bring forth food out of the earth, And oil to make his face to shine, And bread that strengtheneth man"s heart. The cedars of Lebanon, which he hath planted; As for the stork, the fir-trees are her house. The rocks are a refuge for the conies. The sun knoweth his going down. Wherein all the beasts of the forest creep forth. And seek their food from God. And lay them down in their dens. And to his labor until the evening. In wisdom hast thou made them all: The earth is full of thy riches. Wherein are things creeping innumerable, Both small and great beasts. There is leviathan, whom thou hast formed to play therein. That thou mayest give them their food in due season. Thou openest thy hand, they are satisfied with good. Thou takest away their breath, they die, And return to their dust. And thou renewest the face of the ground. Let Jehovah rejoice in his works: He toucheth the mountains, and they smoke. I will sing praise to my God while I have any being. I will rejoice in Jehovah. And let the wicked be no more. Bless Jehovah, O my soul. Praise ye Jehovah.
Who coverest thyself with light as with a garment;
Who layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters;
Who maketh winds his messengers;
Who laid the foundations of the earth,
Thou coveredst it with the deep as with a vesture;
At thy rebuke they fled;
(The mountains rose, the valleys sank down)
Thou hast set a bound that they may not pass over;
He sendeth forth springs into the valleys;
They give drink to every beast of the field;
By them the birds of the heavens have their habitation;
He watereth the mountains from his chambers:
He causeth the grass to grow for the cattle,
And wine that maketh glad the heart of man,
The trees of Jehovah are filled with moisture ,
Where the birds make their nests:
The high mountains are for the wild goats;
He appointed the moon for seasons:
Thou makest darkness, and it is night,
The young lions roar after their prey,
The sun ariseth, they get them away,
Man goeth forth unto his work
O Jehovah, how manifold are thy works!
Yonder is the sea, great and wide,
There go the ships;
These wait all for thee,
Thou givest unto them, they gather;
Thou hidest thy face, they are troubled;
Thou sendest forth thy Spirit, they are created;
Let the glory of Jehovah endure for ever;
Who looketh on the earth, and it trembleth;
I will sing unto Jehovah as long as I live:
Let my meditation be sweet unto him:
Let sinners be consumed out of the earth.

105.verse_text: Oh give thanks unto Jehovah, call upon his name; Make known among the peoples his doings. Talk ye of all his marvellous works. Let the heart of them rejoice that seek Jehovah. Seek his face evermore. His wonders, and the judgments of his mouth, Ye children of Jacob, his chosen ones. His judgments are in all the earth. The word which he commanded to a thousand generations, And his oath unto Isaac, To Israel for an everlasting covenant, The lot of your inheritance; Yea, very few, and sojourners in it. From one kingdom to another people. Yea, he reproved kings for their sakes, And do my prophets no harm. He brake the whole staff of bread. Joseph was sold for a servant: He was laid in chains of iron, The word of Jehovah tried him. Even the ruler of peoples, and let him go free. And ruler of all his substance; And teach his elders wisdom. And Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham. And made them stronger than their adversaries. To deal subtly with his servants. And Aaron whom he had chosen. And wonders in the land of Ham. And they rebelled not against his words. And slew their fish. In the chambers of their kings. And lice in all their borders. And flaming fire in their land. And brake the trees of their borders. And the grasshopper, and that without number, And did eat up the fruit of their ground. The chief of all their strength. And there was not one feeble person among his tribes. For the fear of them had fallen upon them. And fire to give light in the night. And satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
