They ran in the dry places like a river. And Abraham his servant. And his chosen with singing. And they took the labor of the peoples in possession: And observe his laws. Praise ye Jehovah.
Sing unto him, sing praises unto him;
Glory ye in his holy name:
Seek ye Jehovah and his strength;
Remember his marvellous works that he hath done,
O ye seed of Abraham his servant,
He is Jehovah our God:
He hath remembered his covenant for ever,
The covenant which he made with Abraham,
And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a statute,
Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan,
When they were but a few men in number,
And they went about from nation to nation,
He suffered no man to do them wrong;
Saying , Touch not mine anointed ones,
And he called for a famine upon the land;
He sent a man before them;
His feet they hurt with fetters:
Until the time that his word came to pass,
The king sent and loosed him;
He made him lord of his house,
To bind his princes at his pleasure,
Israel also came into Egypt;
And he increased his people greatly,
He turned their heart to hate his people,
He sent Moses his servant,
They set among them his signs,
He sent darkness, and made it dark;
He turned their waters into blood,
Their land swarmed with frogs
He spake, and there came swarms of flies,
He gave them hail for rain,
He smote their vines also and their fig-trees,
He spake, and the locust came,
And did eat up every herb in their land,
He smote also all the first-born in their land,
And he brought them forth with silver and gold;
Egypt was glad when they departed;
He spread a cloud for a covering,
They asked, and he brought quails,
He opened the rock, and waters gushed out;
For he remembered his holy word,
And he brought forth his people with joy,
And he gave them the lands of the nations;
That they might keep his statutes,

106.verse_text: Praise ye Jehovah. Oh give thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good; For his lovingkindness endureth for ever. Or show forth all his praise? And he that doeth righteousness at all times. Oh visit me with thy salvation, That I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, That I may glory with thine inheritance. We have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly. They remembered not the multitude of thy lovingkindnesses, But were rebellious at the sea, even at the Red Sea. That he might make his mighty power to be known. So he led them through the depths, as through a wilderness. And redeemed them from the hand of the enemy. There was not one of them left. They sang his praise. They waited not for his counsel, And tempted God in the desert. But sent leanness into their soul. And Aaron the saint of Jehovah. And covered the company of Abiram. The flame burned up the wicked. And worshipped a molten image. For the likeness of an ox that eateth grass. Who had done great things in Egypt, And terrible things by the Red Sea. Had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, To turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them . They believed not his word, And hearkened not unto the voice of Jehovah. That he would overthrow them in the wilderness, And scatter them in the lands. And ate the sacrifices of the dead. And the plague brake in upon them. And so the plague was stayed. Unto all generations for evermore. So that it went ill with Moses for their sakes; And he spake unadvisedly with his lips. As Jehovah commanded them, And learned their works, Which became a snare unto them. Even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, Whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan; And the land was polluted with blood. And played the harlot in their doings. And he abhorred his inheritance. And they that hated them ruled over them. And they were brought into subjection under their hand. But they were rebellious in their counsel, And were brought low in their iniquity. When he heard their cry: And repented according to the multitude of his lovingkindnesses. Of all those that carried them captive. And gather us from among the nations, To give thanks unto thy holy name, And to triumph in thy praise. From everlasting even to everlasting. And let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye Jehovah.
Who can utter the mighty acts of Jehovah,
Blessed are they that keep justice,
Remember me, O Jehovah, with the favor that thou bearest unto thy people;
That I may see the prosperity of thy chosen,
We have sinned with our fathers,
Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt;
Nevertheless he saved them for his name"s sake,
He rebuked the Red Sea also, and it was dried up:
And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them,
And the waters covered their adversaries;
Then believed they his words;
They soon forgat his works;
But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness,
And he gave them their request,
They envied Moses also in the camp,
The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan,
And a fire was kindled in their company;
They made a calf in Horeb,
Thus they changed their glory
They forgat God their Saviour,
Wondrous works in the land of Ham,
Therefore he said that he would destroy them,
Yea, they despised the pleasant land,
But murmured in their tents,
Therefore he sware unto them,
And that he would overthrow their seed among the nations,
They joined themselves also unto Baal-peor,
Thus they provoked him to anger with their doings;
Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment;
And that was reckoned unto him for righteousness,
They angered him also at the waters of Meribah,
Because they were rebellious against his spirit,
They did not destroy the peoples,
But mingled themselves with the nations,
And served their idols,
Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto demons,
And shed innocent blood,
Thus were they defiled with their works,
Therefore was the wrath of Jehovah kindled against his people,
And he gave them into the hand of the nations;
Their enemies also oppressed them,
Many times did he deliver them;
Nevertheless he regarded their distress,
And he remembered for them his covenant,
He made them also to be pitied
Save us, O Jehovah our God,
Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel,

107.verse_text: O give thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good; For his lovingkindness endureth for ever. Whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the adversary, From the east and from the west, From the north and from the south. They found no city of habitation. Their soul fainted in them. And he delivered them out of their distresses, That they might go to a city of habitation. And for his wonderful works to the children of men! And the hungry soul he filleth with good. Being bound in affliction and iron, And contemned the counsel of the Most High: They fell down, and there was none to help. And he saved them out of their distresses. And brake their bonds in sunder. And for his wonderful works to the children of men! And cut the bars of iron in sunder. And because of their iniquities, are afflicted. And they draw near unto the gates of death. And he saveth them out of their distresses. And delivereth them from their destructions. And for his wonderful works to the children of men! And declare his works with singing. That do business in great waters; And his wonders in the deep. Which lifteth up the waves thereof. Their soul melteth away because of trouble. And are at their wits" end. And he bringeth them out of their distresses. So that the waves thereof are still. So he bringeth them unto their desired haven. And for his wonderful works to the children of men! And praise him in the seat of the elders. And watersprings into a thirsty ground; For the wickedness of them that dwell therein. And a dry land into watersprings. That they may prepare a city of habitation, And get them fruits of increase. And he suffereth not their cattle to decrease. Through oppression, trouble, and sorrow. And causeth them to wander in the waste, where there is no way. And maketh him families like a flock. And all iniquity shall stop her mouth. And they will consider the lovingkindnesses of Jehovah.
Let the redeemed of Jehovah say so ,
And gathered out of the lands,
They wandered in the wilderness in a desert way;
Hungry and thirsty,
Then they cried unto Jehovah in their trouble,
He led them also by a straight way,
Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness,
For he satisfieth the longing soul,
Such as sat in darkness and in the shadow of death,
Because they rebelled against the words of God,
Therefore he brought down their heart with labor;
Then they cried unto Jehovah in their trouble,
He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death,
Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness,
For he hath broken the gates of brass,
Fools because of their transgression,
Their soul abhorreth all manner of food;
Then they cry unto Jehovah in their trouble,
He sendeth his word, and healeth them,
Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness,
And let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving,
They that go down to the sea in ships,
These see the works of Jehovah,
For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind,
They mount up to the heavens, they go down again to the depths:
They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man,
Then they cry unto Jehovah in their trouble,
He maketh the storm a calm,
Then are they glad because they are quiet;
Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness,
Let them exalt him also in the assembly of the people,
He turneth rivers into a wilderness,
A fruitful land into a salt desert,
He turneth a wilderness into a pool of water,
And there he maketh the hungry to dwell,
And sow fields, and plant vineyards,
He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly;
Again, they are diminished and bowed down
He poureth contempt upon princes,
Yet setteth he the needy on high from affliction,
The upright shall see it, and be glad;
Whoso is wise will give heed to these things;

108.verse_text: My heart is fixed, O God; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises, even with my glory. I myself will awake right early. And I will sing praises unto thee among the nations. And thy truth reacheth unto the skies. And thy glory above all the earth. Save with thy right hand, and answer us. I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth. Ephraim also is the defence of my head; Judah is my sceptre. Upon Edom will I cast my shoe; Over Philistia will I shout. Who hath led me unto Edom? And thou goest not forth, O God, with our hosts. For vain is the help of man. For he it is that will tread down our adversaries.
I will give thanks unto thee, O Jehovah, among the peoples;
For thy lovingkindness is great above the heavens;
Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens,
That thy beloved may be delivered,
God hath spoken in his holiness: I will exult;
Gilead is mine; Manasseh is mine;
Who will bring me into the fortified city?
Hast not thou cast us off, O God?
Give us help against the adversary;
Through God we shall do valiantly:

109.verse_text: Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise; They have spoken unto me with a lying tongue. And fought against me without a cause. But I give myself unto prayer. And hatred for my love. And let an adversary stand at his right hand. And let his prayer be turned into sin. And let another take his office. And his wife a widow. And let them seek their bread out of their desolate places. And let strangers make spoil of his labor. Neither let there be any to have pity on his fatherless children. In the generation following let their name be blotted out. And let not the sin of his mother be blotted out. That he may cut off the memory of them from the earth; But persecuted the poor and needy man, And the broken in heart, to slay them . And he delighted not in blessing, and it was far from him. And it came into his inward parts like water, And like oil into his bones. And for the girdle wherewith he is girded continually. And of them that speak evil against my soul. Because thy lovingkindness is good, deliver thou me; And my heart is wounded within me. I am tossed up and down as the locust. And my flesh faileth of fatness. When they see me, they shake their head. Oh save me according to thy lovingkindness: That thou, Jehovah, hast done it. When they arise, they shall be put to shame, But thy servant shall rejoice. And let them cover themselves with their own shame as with a robe. Yea, I will praise him among the multitude. To save him from them that judge his soul.
For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of deceit have they opened against me:
They have compassed me about also with words of hatred,
For my love they are my adversaries:
And they have rewarded me evil for good,
Set thou a wicked man over him;
When he is judged, let him come forth guilty;
Let his days be few;
Let his children be fatherless,
Let his children be vagabonds, and beg;
Let the extortioner catch all that he hath;
Let there be none to extend kindness unto him;
Let his posterity be cut off;
Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with Jehovah;
Let them be before Jehovah continually,
Because he remembered not to show kindness,
Yea, he loved cursing, and it came unto him;
He clothed himself also with cursing as with his garment,
Let it be unto him as the raiment wherewith he covereth himself,
This is the reward of mine adversaries from Jehovah,
But deal thou with me, O Jehovah the Lord, for thy name"s sake:
For I am poor and needy,
I am gone like the shadow when it declineth:
My knees are weak through fasting;
I am become also a reproach unto them:
Help me, O Jehovah my God;
That they may know that this is thy hand;
Let them curse, but bless thou:
Let mine adversaries be clothed with dishonor,
I will give great thanks unto Jehovah with my mouth;
For he will stand at the right hand of the needy,

110.verse_text: Jehovah saith unto my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand, Until I make thine enemies thy footstool. Rule thou in the midst of thine enemies. In the day of thy power, in holy array: Out of the womb of the morning Thou hast the dew of thy youth. Thou art a priest for ever After the order of Melchizedek. Will strike through kings in the day of his wrath. He will fill the places with dead bodies; He will strike through the head in many countries. Therefore will he lift up the head.
Jehovah will send forth the rod of thy strength out of Zion:
Jehovah hath sworn, and will not repent:
The Lord at thy right hand
He will judge among the nations,
He will drink of the brook in the way:

111.verse_text: Praise ye Jehovah. I will give thanks unto Jehovah with my whole heart, In the council of the upright, and in the congregation. Sought out of all them that have pleasure therein. And his righteousness endureth for ever. Jehovah is gracious and merciful. He will ever be mindful of his covenant. In giving them the heritage of the nations. All his precepts are sure. They are done in truth and uprightness. He hath commanded his covenant for ever: Holy and reverend is his name. A good understanding have all they that do his commandments : His praise endureth for ever.
The works of Jehovah are great,
His work is honor and majesty;
He hath made his wonderful works to be remembered:
He hath given food unto them that fear him:
He hath showed his people the power of his works,
The works of his hands are truth and justice;
They are established for ever and ever;
He hath sent redemption unto his people;
The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of wisdom;

112.verse_text: Praise ye Jehovah. Blessed is the man that feareth Jehovah, That delighteth greatly in his commandments. The generation of the upright shall be blessed. And his righteousness endureth for ever. He is gracious, and merciful, and righteous. He shall maintain his cause in judgment. The righteous shall be had in everlasting remembrance. His heart is fixed, trusting in Jehovah. Until he see his desire upon his adversaries. His righteousness endureth for ever: His horn shall be exalted with honor. He shall gnash with his teeth, and melt away: The desire of the wicked shall perish.
His seed shall be mighty upon earth:
Wealth and riches are in his house;
Unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness:
Well is it with the man that dealeth graciously and lendeth;
For he shall never be moved;
He shall not be afraid of evil tidings:
His heart is established, he shall not be afraid,
He hath dispersed, he hath given to the needy;
The wicked shall see it, and be grieved;

113.verse_text: Praise ye Jehovah. Praise, O ye servants of Jehovah, Praise the name of Jehovah. From this time forth and for evermore. Jehovah"s name is to be praised. And his glory above the heavens. That hath his seat on high, The things that are in heaven and in the earth? And lifteth up the needy from the dunghill; Even with the princes of his people. And to be a joyful mother of children. Praise ye Jehovah.
Blessed be the name of Jehovah
From the rising of the sun unto the going down of the same
Jehovah is high above all nations,
Who is like unto Jehovah our God,
He raiseth up the poor out of the dust,
That he may set him with princes,
He maketh the barren woman to keep house,

114.verse_text: When Israel went forth out of Egypt, The house of Jacob from a people of strange language; Israel his dominion. The Jordan was driven back. The little hills like lambs. Thou Jordan, that thou turnest back? Ye little hills, like lambs? At the presence of the God of Jacob, The flint into a fountain of waters.
The sea saw it, and fled;
What aileth thee, O thou sea, that thou fleest?
Ye mountains, that ye skip like rams;
Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord,
Who turned the rock into a pool of water,

115.verse_text: Not unto us, O Jehovah, not unto us, But unto thy name give glory, For thy lovingkindness, and for thy truth"s sake. Where is now their God? He hath done whatsoever he pleased. The work of men"s hands. Eyes have they, but they see not; Noses have they, but they smell not; Feet have they, but they walk not; Neither speak they through their throat. Yea, every one that trusteth in them. He is their help and their shield. He is their help and their shield. He is their help and their shield. He will bless the house of Israel; He will bless the house of Aaron. Both small and great. You and your children. Who made heaven and earth. But the earth hath he given to the children of men. Neither any that go down into silence; From this time forth and for evermore. Praise ye Jehovah.
But our God is in the heavens:
Their idols are silver and gold,
They have mouths, but they speak not;
They have ears, but they hear not;
They have hands, but they handle not;
They that make them shall be like unto them;
O Israel, trust thou in Jehovah:
O house of Aaron, trust ye in Jehovah:
Ye that fear Jehovah, trust in Jehovah:
Jehovah hath been mindful of us; he will bless us :
He will bless them that fear Jehovah,
Jehovah increase you more and more,
The heavens are the heavens of Jehovah;

116.verse_text: I love Jehovah, because he heareth My voice and my supplications. Therefore will I call upon him as long as I live. And the pains of Sheol gat hold upon me: I found trouble and sorrow. O Jehovah, I beseech thee, deliver my soul. Yea, our God is merciful. I was brought low, and he saved me. For Jehovah hath dealt bountifully with thee. Mine eyes from tears, And my feet from falling. In the land of the living. I was greatly afflicted: All men are liars. For all his benefits toward me? And call upon the name of Jehovah. Yea, in the presence of all his people. Is the death of his saints. I am thy servant, the son of thy handmaid; Thou hast loosed my bonds. And will call upon the name of Jehovah. Yea, in the presence of all his people, In the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Praise ye Jehovah.
Because he hath inclined his ear unto me,
The cords of death compassed me,
Then called I upon the name of Jehovah:
Return unto thy rest, O my soul;
For thou hast delivered my soul from death,
I believe, for I will speak:
What shall I render unto Jehovah
I will take the cup of salvation,
I will pay my vows unto Jehovah,
Precious in the sight of Jehovah
O Jehovah, truly I am thy servant:
I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving,
I will pay my vows unto Jehovah,
In the courts of Jehovah"s house,

117.verse_text: O praise Jehovah, all ye nations; Laud him, all ye peoples. And the truth of Jehovah endureth for ever. Praise ye Jehovah.
For his lovingkindness is great toward us;

118.verse_text: Oh give thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good; For his lovingkindness endureth for ever. That his lovingkindness endureth for ever. That his lovingkindness endureth for ever. That his lovingkindness endureth for ever. Jehovah answered me and set me in a large place. What can man do unto me? Therefore shall I see my desire upon them that hate me. Than to put confidence in man. Than to put confidence in princes. In the name of Jehovah I will cut them off. In the name of Jehovah I will cut them off. In the name of Jehovah I will cut them off. But Jehovah helped me. And he is become my salvation. The right hand of Jehovah doeth valiantly. The right hand of Jehovah doeth valiantly. And declare the works of Jehovah. But he hath not given me over unto death. I will enter into them, I will give thanks unto Jehovah. The righteous shall enter into it. And art become my salvation. Is become the head of the corner. It is marvellous in our eyes. We will rejoice and be glad in it. O Jehovah, we beseech thee, send now prosperity. We have blessed you out of the house of Jehovah. Bind the sacrifice with cords, even unto the horns of the altar. Thou art my God, I will exalt thee. For his lovingkindness endureth for ever.
Let Israel now say,
Let the house of Aaron now say,
Let them now that fear Jehovah say,
Out of my distress I called upon Jehovah:
Jehovah is on my side; I will not fear:
Jehovah is on my side among them that help me:
It is better to take refuge in Jehovah
It is better to take refuge in Jehovah
All nations compassed me about:
They compassed me about; yea, they compassed me about:
They compassed me about like bees; they are quenched as the fire of thorns:
Thou didst thrust sore at me that I might fall;
Jehovah is my strength and song;
The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tents of the righteous:
The right hand of Jehovah is exalted:
I shall not die, but live,
Jehovah hath chastened me sore;
Open to me the gates of righteousness:
This is the gate of Jehovah;
I will give thanks unto thee; for thou hast answered me,
The stone which the builders rejected
This is Jehovah"s doing;
This is the day which Jehovah hath made;
Save now, we beseech thee, O Jehovah:
Blessed be he that cometh in the name of Jehovah:
Jehovah is God, and he hath given us light:
Thou art my God, and I will give thanks unto thee:
Oh give thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good;

119.verse_text: Blessed are they that are perfect in the way, Who walk in the law of Jehovah. That seek him with the whole heart. They walk in his ways. That we should observe them diligently. To observe thy statutes! When I have respect unto all thy commandments. When I learn thy righteous judgments. Oh forsake me not utterly. ×‘ BETH. By taking heed thereto according to thy word. Oh let me not wander from thy commandments. That I might not sin against thee. Teach me thy statutes. All the ordinances of thy mouth. As much as in all riches. And have respect unto thy ways. I will not forget thy word. ×’ GIMEL. So will I observe thy word. Wondrous things out of thy law. Hide not thy commandments from me. That it hath unto thine ordinances at all times. That do wander from thy commandments. For I have kept thy testimonies. But thy servant did meditate on thy statutes. And my counsellors. ×“ DALETH. Quicken thou me according to thy word. Teach me thy statutes. So shall I meditate on thy wondrous works. Strengthen thou me according unto thy word. And grant me thy law graciously. Thine ordinances have I set before me . O Jehovah, put me not to shame. When thou shalt enlarge my heart. ×” HE. And I shall keep it unto the end. Yea, I shall observe it with my whole heart. For therein do I delight. And not to covetousness. And quicken me in thy ways. Which is in order unto the fear of thee. For thine ordinances are good. Quicken me in thy righteousness. ×• VAV. Even thy salvation, according to thy word. For I trust in thy word. For I have hoped in thine ordinances. For ever and ever. For I have sought thy precepts. And shall not be put to shame. Which I have loved. And I will meditate on thy statutes. ×– ZAYIN. Because thou hast made me to hope. For thy word hath quickened me. Yet have I not swerved from thy law. And have comforted myself. Because of the wicked that forsake thy law. In the house of my pilgrimage. And have observed thy law. Because I have kept thy precepts. ×— HHETH. I have said that I would observe thy words. Be merciful unto me according to thy word. And turned my feet unto thy testimonies. To observe thy commandments. But I have not forgotten thy law. Because of thy righteous ordinances. And of them that observe thy precepts. Teach me thy statutes. ×˜ TETH. O Jehovah, according unto thy word. For I have believed in thy commandments. But now I observe thy word. Teach me thy statutes. With my whole heart will I keep thy precepts. But I delight in thy law. That I may learn thy statutes. Than thousands of gold and silver. ×™ YODH. Give me understanding, that I may learn thy commandments. Because I have hoped in thy word. And that in faithfulness thou hast afflicted me. According to thy word unto thy servant. For thy law is my delight. But I will meditate on thy precepts. And they shall know thy testimonies. That I be not put to shame. ×› KAPH. But I hope in thy word. While I say, When wilt thou comfort me? Yet do I not forget thy statutes. When wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me? Who are not according to thy law. They persecute me wrongfully; help thou me. But I forsook not thy precepts. So shall I observe the testimony of thy mouth. ×œ LAMEDH. Thy word is settled in heaven. Thou hast established the earth, and it abideth. For all things are thy servants. I should then have perished in mine affliction. For with them thou hast quickened me. For I have sought thy precepts. But I will consider thy testimonies. But thy commandment is exceeding broad. ×ž MEM. It is my meditation all the day. For they are ever with me. For thy testimonies are my meditation. Because I have kept thy precepts. That I might observe thy word. For thou hast taught me. Yea, sweeter than honey to my mouth! Therefore I hate every false way. ×  NUN. And light unto my path. That I will observe thy righteous ordinances. Quicken me, O Jehovah, according unto thy word. And teach me thine ordinances. Yet do I not forget thy law. Yet have I not gone astray from thy precepts. For they are the rejoicing of my heart. For ever, even unto the end. ×¡ SAMEKH. But thy law do I love. I hope in thy word. That I may keep the commandments of my God. And let me not be ashamed of my hope. And shall have respect unto thy statutes continually. For their deceit is falsehood. Therefore I love thy testimonies. And I am afraid of thy judgments. ×¢ AYIN. Leave me not to mine oppressors. Let not the proud oppress me. And for thy righteous word. And teach me thy statutes. That I may know thy testimonies. For they have made void thy law. Above gold, yea, above fine gold. And I hate every false way. ×¤ PE. Therefore doth my soul keep them. It giveth understanding unto the simple. For I longed for thy commandments. As thou usest to do unto those that love thy name. And let not any iniquity have dominion over me. So will I observe thy precepts. And teach me thy statutes. Because they observe not thy law. ×¦ TSADHE. And upright are thy judgments. And very faithfulness. Because mine adversaries have forgotten thy words. Therefore thy servant loveth it. Yet do I not forget thy precepts. And thy law is truth. Yet thy commandments are my delight. Give me understanding, and I shall live. ×§ QOPH. I will keep thy statutes. And I shall observe thy testimonies. I hoped in thy words. That I might meditate on thy word. Quicken me, O Jehovah, according to thine ordinances. They are far from thy law. And all thy commandments are truth. That thou hast founded them for ever. ×¨ RESH. For I do not forget thy law. Quicken me according to thy word. For they seek not thy statutes. Quicken me according to thine ordinances. Yet have I not swerved from thy testimonies. Because they observe not thy word. Quicken me, O Jehovah, according to thy lovingkindness. And every one of thy righteous ordinances endureth for ever. ×© SHIN. But my heart standeth in awe of thy words. As one that findeth great spoil. But thy law do I love. Because of thy righteous ordinances. And they have no occasion of stumbling. And have done thy commandments. And I love them exceedingly. For all my ways are before thee. ×ª TAV. Give me understanding according to thy word. Deliver me according to thy word. For thou teachest me thy statutes. For all thy commandments are righteousness. For I have chosen thy precepts. And thy law is my delight. And let thine ordinances help me. For I do not forget thy commandments.
Blessed are they that keep his testimonies,
Yea, they do no unrighteousness;
Thou hast commanded us thy precepts,
Oh that my ways were established
Then shall I not be put to shame,
I will give thanks unto thee with uprightness of heart,
I will observe thy statutes:
Wherewith shall a young man cleanse his way?
With my whole heart have I sought thee:
Thy word have I laid up in my heart,
Blessed art thou, O Jehovah:
With my lips have I declared
I have rejoiced in the way of thy testimonies,
I will meditate on thy precepts,
I will delight myself in thy statutes:
Deal bountifully with thy servant, that I may live;
Open thou mine eyes, that I may behold
I am a sojourner in the earth:
My soul breaketh for the longing
Thou hast rebuked the proud that are cursed,
Take away from me reproach and contempt;
Princes also sat and talked against me;
Thy testimonies also are my delight
My soul cleaveth unto the dust:
I declared my ways, and thou answeredst me:
Make me to understand the way of thy precepts:
My soul melteth for heaviness:
Remove from me the way of falsehood;
I have chosen the way of faithfulness:
I cleave unto thy testimonies:
I will run the way of thy commandments,
Teach me, O Jehovah, the way of thy statutes;
Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law;
Make me to go in the path of thy commandments;
Incline my heart unto thy testimonies,
Turn away mine eyes from beholding vanity,
Confirm unto thy servant thy word,
Turn away my reproach whereof I am afraid;
Behold, I have longed after thy precepts:
Let thy lovingkindnesses also come unto me, O Jehovah,
So shall I have an answer for him that reproacheth me;
And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth;
So shall I observe thy law continually
And I shall walk at liberty;
I will also speak of thy testimonies before kings,
And I will delight myself in thy commandments,
I will lift up my hands also unto thy commandments, which I have loved;
Remember the word unto thy servant,
This is my comfort in my affliction;
The proud have had me greatly in derision:
I have remembered thine ordinances of old, O Jehovah,
Hot indignation hath taken hold upon me,
Thy statutes have been my songs
I have remembered thy name, O Jehovah, in the night,
This I have had,
Jehovah is my portion:
I entreated thy favor with my whole heart:
I thought on my ways,
I made haste, and delayed not,
The cords of the wicked have wrapped me round;
At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee
I am a companion of all them that fear thee,
The earth, O Jehovah, is full of thy lovingkindness:
Thou hast dealt well with thy servant,
Teach me good judgment and knowledge;
Before I was afflicted I went astray;
Thou art good, and doest good;
The proud have forged a lie against me:
Their heart is as fat as grease;
It is good for me that I have been afflicted;
The law of thy mouth is better unto me
Thy hands have made me and fashioned me:
They that fear thee shall see me and be glad,
I know, O Jehovah, that thy judgments are righteous,
Let, I pray thee, thy lovingkindness be for my comfort,
Let thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may live;
Let the proud be put to shame; for they have overthrown me wrongfully:
Let those that fear thee turn unto me;
Let my heart be perfect in thy statutes,
My soul fainteth for thy salvation;
Mine eyes fail for thy word,
For I am become like a wine-skin in the smoke;
How many are the days of thy servant?
The proud have digged pits for me,
All thy commandments are faithful:
They had almost consumed me upon earth;
Quicken me after thy lovingkindness;
For ever, O Jehovah,
Thy faithfulness is unto all generations:
They abide this day according to thine ordinances;
Unless thy law had been my delight,
I will never forget thy precepts;
I am thine, save me;
The wicked have waited for me, to destroy me;
I have seen an end of all perfection;
Oh how love I thy law!
Thy commandments make me wiser than mine enemies;
I have more understanding than all my teachers;
I understand more than the aged,
I have refrained my feet from every evil way,
I have not turned aside from thine ordinances;
How sweet are thy words unto my taste!
Through thy precepts I get understanding:
Thy word is a lamp unto my feet,
I have sworn, and have confirmed it,
I am afflicted very much:
Accept, I beseech thee, the freewill-offerings of my mouth, O Jehovah,
My soul is continually in my hand;
The wicked have laid a snare for me;
Thy testimonies have I taken as a heritage for ever;
I have inclined my heart to perform thy statutes
I hate them that are of a double mind;
Thou art my hiding-place and my shield:
Depart from me, ye evil-doers,
Uphold me according unto thy word, that I may live;
Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe,
Thou hast set at nought all them that err from thy statutes;
Thou puttest away all the wicked of the earth like dross:
My flesh trembleth for fear of thee;
I have done justice and righteousness:
Be surety for thy servant for good:
Mine eyes fail for thy salvation,
Deal with thy servant according unto thy lovingkindness,
I am thy servant; give me understanding,
It is time for Jehovah to work;
Therefore I love thy commandments
Therefore I esteem all thy precepts concerning all things to be right;
Thy testimonies are wonderful;
The opening of thy words giveth light;
I opened wide my mouth, and panted;
Turn thee unto me, and have mercy upon me,
Establish my footsteps in thy word;
Redeem me from the oppression of man:
Make thy face to shine upon thy servant;
Streams of water run down mine eyes,
Righteous art thou, O Jehovah,
Thou hast commanded thy testimonies in righteousness
My zeal hath consumed me,
Thy word is very pure;
I am small and despised;
Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,
Trouble and anguish have taken hold on me;
Thy testimonies are righteous for ever:
I have called with my whole heart; answer me, O Jehovah:
I have called unto thee; save me,
I anticipated the dawning of the morning, and cried:
Mine eyes anticipated the night-watches,
Hear my voice according unto thy lovingkindness:
They draw nigh that follow after wickedness;
Thou art nigh, O Jehovah;
Of old have I known from thy testimonies,
Consider mine affliction, and deliver me;
Plead thou my cause, and redeem me:
Salvation is far from the wicked;
Great are thy tender mercies, O Jehovah:
Many are my persecutors and mine adversaries;
I beheld the treacherous, and was grieved,
Consider how I love thy precepts:
The sum of thy word is truth;
Princes have persecuted me without a cause;
I rejoice at thy word,
I hate and abhor falsehood;
Seven times a day do I praise thee,
Great peace have they that love thy law;
I have hoped for thy salvation, O Jehovah,
My soul hath observed thy testimonies;
I have observed thy precepts and thy testimonies;
Let my cry come near before thee, O Jehovah:
Let my supplication come before thee:
Let my lips utter praise;
Let my tongue sing of thy word;
Let thy hand be ready to help me;
I have longed for thy salvation, O Jehovah;
Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee;
I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek thy servant;

120.verse_text: In my distress I cried unto Jehovah, And he answered me. And from a deceitful tongue. Thou deceitful tongue? With coals of juniper. That I dwell among the tents of Kedar! With him that hateth peace. But when I speak, they are for war.
Deliver my soul, O Jehovah, from lying lips,
What shall be given unto thee, and what shall be done more unto thee,
Woe is me, that I sojourn in Meshech,
My soul hath long had her dwelling

121.verse_text: I will lift up mine eyes unto the mountains: From whence shall my help come? Who made heaven and earth. He that keepeth thee will not slumber. Will neither slumber nor sleep. Jehovah is thy shade upon thy right hand. Nor the moon by night. He will keep thy soul. From this time forth and for evermore.
He will not suffer thy foot to be moved:
The sun shall not smite thee by day,
Jehovah will keep thee from all evil;
Jehovah will keep thy going out and thy coming in

122.verse_text: I was glad when they said unto me, Let us go unto the house of Jehovah. Within thy gates, O Jerusalem, As a city that is compact together; For an ordinance for Israel, To give thanks unto the name of Jehovah. The thrones of the house of David. They shall prosper that love thee. And prosperity within thy palaces. I will now say, Peace be within thee. I will seek thy good.
Whither the tribes go up, even the tribes of Jehovah,
For there are set thrones for judgment,
Pray for the peace of Jerusalem:
For my brethren and companions" sakes,
For the sake of the house of Jehovah our God

123.verse_text: Unto thee do I lift up mine eyes, O thou that sittest in the heavens. As the eyes of a maid unto the hand of her mistress; So our eyes look unto Jehovah our God, Until he have mercy upon us. For we are exceedingly filled with contempt. With the scoffing of those that are at ease, And with the contempt of the proud.
Behold, as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their master,
Have mercy upon us, O Jehovah, have mercy upon us;

124.verse_text: If it had not been Jehovah who was on our side, Let Israel now say, When men rose up against us; When their wrath was kindled against us: The stream had gone over our soul; Who hath not given us as a prey to their teeth. The snare is broken, and we are escaped. Who made heaven and earth.
If it had not been Jehovah who was on our side,
Then they had swallowed us up alive,
Then the waters had overwhelmed us,
Then the proud waters had gone over our soul.
Our soul is escaped as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers:
Our help is in the name of Jehovah,

125.verse_text: They that trust in Jehovah Are as mount Zion, which cannot be moved, but abideth for ever. So Jehovah is round about his people From this time forth and for evermore. That the righteous put not forth their hands unto iniquity. And to them that are upright in their hearts. Jehovah will lead them forth with the workers of iniquity. Peace be upon Israel.
As the mountains are round about Jerusalem,
For the sceptre of wickedness shall not rest upon the lot of the righteous;
Do good, O Jehovah, unto those that are good,
But as for such as turn aside unto their crooked ways,

126.verse_text: When Jehovah brought back those that returned to Zion, We were like unto them that dream. And our tongue with singing: Then said they among the nations, Jehovah hath done great things for them. Whereof we are glad. As the streams in the South. Shall doubtless come again with joy, bringing his sheaves with him .
Then was our mouth filled with laughter,
Jehovah hath done great things for us,
Turn again our captivity, O Jehovah,
They that sow in tears shall reap in joy.
He that goeth forth and weepeth, bearing seed for sowing,

127.verse_text: Except Jehovah build the house, They labor in vain that build it: Except Jehovah keep the city, The watchman waketh but in vain. To take rest late, To eat the bread of toil; For so he giveth unto his beloved sleep. And the fruit of the womb is his reward. So are the children of youth. They shall not be put to shame, When they speak with their enemies in the gate.
It is vain for you to rise up early,
Lo, children are a heritage of Jehovah;
As arrows in the hand of a mighty man,
Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them:

128.verse_text: Blessed is every one that feareth Jehovah, That walketh in his ways. Happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee. In the innermost parts of thy house; Thy children like olive plants, Round about thy table. That feareth Jehovah. And see thou the good of Jerusalem all the days of thy life. Peace be upon Israel.
For thou shalt eat the labor of thy hands:
Thy wife shall be as a fruitful vine,
Behold, thus shall the man be blessed
Jehovah bless thee out of Zion:
Yea, see thou thy children"s children.

129.verse_text: Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth up, Let Israel now say, Yet they have not prevailed against me. They made long their furrows. He hath cut asunder the cords of the wicked. All they that hate Zion. Which withereth before it groweth up; Nor he that bindeth sheaves, his bosom: The blessing of Jehovah be upon you; We bless you in the name of Jehovah.
Many a time have they afflicted me from my youth up:
The plowers plowed upon my back;
Let them be put to shame and turned backward,
Let them be as the grass upon the housetops,
Wherewith the reaper filleth not his hand,
Neither do they that go by say,

130.verse_text: Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O Jehovah. Let thine ears be attentive To the voice of my supplications. O Lord, who could stand? That thou mayest be feared. And in his word do I hope. More than watchmen wait for the morning; Yea, more than watchmen for the morning. For with Jehovah there is lovingkindness, And with him is plenteous redemption. From all his iniquities.
If thou, Jehovah, shouldest mark iniquities,
But there is forgiveness with thee,
I wait for Jehovah, my soul doth wait,
My soul waiteth for the Lord

131.verse_text: Jehovah, my heart is not haughty, nor mine eyes lofty; Neither do I exercise myself in great matters, Or in things too wonderful for me. Like a weaned child with his mother, Like a weaned child is my soul within me. From this time forth and for evermore.
Surely I have stilled and quieted my soul;

132.verse_text: Jehovah, remember for David All his affliction; And vowed unto the Mighty One of Jacob: Nor go up into my bed; Or slumber to mine eyelids; A tabernacle for the Mighty One of Jacob. We found it in the field of the wood. We will worship at his footstool. Thou, and the ark of thy strength. And let thy saints shout for joy. Turn not away the face of thine anointed. He will not turn from it: Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne. And my testimony that I shall teach them, Their children also shall sit upon thy throne for evermore. He hath desired it for his habitation. Here will I dwell; for I have desired it. I will satisfy her poor with bread. And her saints shall shout aloud for joy. I have ordained a lamp for mine anointed. But upon himself shall his crown flourish.
Surely I will not come into the tabernacle of my house,
I will not give sleep to mine eyes,
Until I find out a place for Jehovah,
Lo, we heard of it in Ephrathah:
We will go into his tabernacles;
Arise, O Jehovah, into thy resting-place;
Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness;
Jehovah hath sworn unto David in truth;
If thy children will keep my covenant
This is my resting-place for ever:
I will abundantly bless her provision:
Her priests also will I clothe with salvation;
There will I make the horn of David to bud:
His enemies will I clothe with shame;

133.verse_text: Behold, how good and how pleasant it is For brethren to dwell together in unity! That ran down upon the beard, Even Aaron"s beard; That came down upon the skirt of his garments; That cometh down upon the mountains of Zion: For there Jehovah commanded the blessing, Even life for evermore.
It is like the precious oil upon the head,

134.verse_text: Behold, bless ye Jehovah, all ye servants of Jehovah, That by night stand in the house of Jehovah. And bless ye Jehovah. Even he that made heaven and earth.
Lift up your hands to the sanctuary,
Jehovah bless thee out of Zion;

135.verse_text: Praise ye Jehovah. Praise ye the name of Jehovah; Praise him , O ye servants of Jehovah, In the courts of the house of our God. Sing praises unto his name; for it is pleasant. And Israel for his own possession. And that our Lord is above all gods. In heaven and in earth, in the seas and in all deeps; Who maketh lightnings for the rain; Who bringeth forth the wind out of his treasuries; Both of man and beast; Upon Pharaoh, and upon all his servants; And slew mighty kings, And Og king of Bashan, And all the kingdoms of Canaan, A heritage unto Israel his people. Thy memorial name , O Jehovah, throughout all generations. And repent himself concerning his servants. The work of men"s hands. Eyes have they, but they see not; Neither is there any breath in their mouths. Yea, every one that trusteth in them. O house of Aaron, bless ye Jehovah: Ye that fear Jehovah, bless ye Jehovah. Who dwelleth at Jerusalem. Praise ye Jehovah.
Ye that stand in the house of Jehovah,
Praise ye Jehovah; for Jehovah is good:
For Jehovah hath chosen Jacob unto himself,
For I know that Jehovah is great,
Whatsoever Jehovah pleased, that hath he done,
Who causeth the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth;
Who smote the first-born of Egypt,
Who sent signs and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt,
Who smote many nations,
Sihon king of the Amorites,
And gave their land for a heritage,
Thy name, O Jehovah, endureth for ever;
For Jehovah will judge his people,
The idols of the nations are silver and gold,
They have mouths, but they speak not;
They have ears, but they hear not;
They that make them shall be like unto them;
O house of Israel, bless ye Jehovah:
O house of Levi, bless ye Jehovah:
Blessed be Jehovah out of Zion,

136.verse_text: Oh give thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good; For his lovingkindness endureth for ever. For his lovingkindness endureth for ever. For his lovingkindness endureth for ever: For his lovingkindness endureth for ever: For his lovingkindness endureth for ever: For his lovingkindness endureth for ever: For his lovingkindness endureth for ever: For his lovingkindness endureth for ever; For his lovingkindness endureth for ever: For his lovingkindness endureth for ever; For his lovingkindness endureth for ever; For his lovingkindness endureth for ever: For his lovingkindness endureth for ever; For his lovingkindness endureth for ever; For his lovingkindness endureth for ever: For his lovingkindness endureth for ever: For his lovingkindness endureth for ever; For his lovingkindness endureth for ever: For his lovingkindness endureth forever; For his lovingkindness endureth for ever; For his lovingkindness endureth for ever; For his lovingkindness endureth for ever: For his lovingkindness endureth for ever; For his lovingkindness endureth for ever: For his lovingkindness endureth for ever. For his lovingkindness endureth for ever.
Oh give thanks unto the God of gods;
Oh give thanks unto the Lord of lords;
To him who alone doeth great wonders;
To him that by understanding made the heavens;
To him that spread forth the earth above the waters;
To him that made great lights;
The sun to rule by day;
The moon and stars to rule by night;
To him that smote Egypt in their first-born;
And brought out Israel from among them;
With a strong hand, and with an outstretched arm;
To him that divided the Red Sea in sunder;
And made Israel to pass through the midst of it;
But overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red Sea;
To him that led his people through the wilderness;
To him that smote great kings;
And slew famous kings;
Sihon king of the Amorites;
And Og king of Bashan;
And gave their land for a heritage;
Even a heritage unto Israel his servant;
Who remembered us in our low estate;
And hath delivered us from our adversaries;
Who giveth food to all flesh;
Oh give thanks unto the God of heaven;

137.verse_text: By the rivers of Babylon, There we sat down, yea, we wept, When we remembered Zion. We hanged up our harps. And they that wasted us required of us mirth, saying , Sing us one of the songs of Zion. In a foreign land? Let my right hand forget her skill . If I remember thee not; If I prefer not Jerusalem Above my chief joy. The day of Jerusalem; Who said, Rase it, rase it, Even to the foundation thereof. Happy shall he be, that rewardeth thee As thou hast served us. Against the rock.
Upon the willows in the midst thereof
For there they that led us captive required of us songs,
How shall we sing Jehovah"s song
If I forget thee, O Jerusalem,
Let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth,
Remember, O Jehovah, against the children of Edom
O daughter of Babylon, that art to be destroyed,
Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones

138.verse_text: I will give thee thanks with my whole heart: Before the gods will I sing praises unto thee. And give thanks unto thy name for thy lovingkindness and for thy truth: For thou hast magnified thy word above all thy name. Thou didst encourage me with strength in my soul. For they have heard the words of thy mouth. For great is the glory of Jehovah. But the haughty he knoweth from afar. Thou wilt stretch forth thy hand against the wrath of mine enemies, And thy right hand will save me. Thy lovingkindness, O Jehovah, endureth for ever; Forsake not the works of thine own hands.
I will worship toward thy holy temple,
In the day that I called thou answeredst me,
All the kings of the earth shall give thee thanks, O Jehovah,
Yea, they shall sing of the ways of Jehovah;
For though Jehovah is high, yet hath he respect unto the lowly;
Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me;
Jehovah will perfect that which concerneth me:

139.verse_text: O Jehovah, thou hast searched me, and known me . Thou understandest my thought afar off. And art acquainted with all my ways. But, lo, O Jehovah, thou knowest it altogether. And laid thy hand upon me. It is high, I cannot attain unto it. Or whither shall I flee from thy presence? If I make my bed in Sheol, behold, thou art there. And dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea; And thy right hand shall hold me. And the light about me shall be night; But the night shineth as the day: The darkness and the light are both alike to thee . Thou didst cover me in my mother"s womb. Wonderful are thy works; And that my soul knoweth right well. When I was made in secret, And curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth. And in thy book they were all written, Even the days that were ordained for me , When as yet there was none of them. How great is the sum of them! When I awake, I am still with thee. Depart from me therefore, ye bloodthirsty men. And thine enemies take thy name in vain. And am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee? They are become mine enemies. Try me, and know my thoughts; And lead me in the way everlasting.
Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising;
Thou searchest out my path and my lying down,
For there is not a word in my tongue,
Thou hast beset me behind and before,
Such knowledge is too wonderful for me;
Whither shall I go from thy Spirit?
If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there:
If I take the wings of the morning,
Even there shall thy hand lead me,
If I say, Surely the darkness shall overwhelm me,
Even the darkness hideth not from thee,
For thou didst form my inward parts:
I will give thanks unto thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made:
My frame was not hidden from thee,
Thine eyes did see mine unformed substance;
How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God!
If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand:
Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God:
For they speak against thee wickedly,
Do not I hate them, O Jehovah, that hate thee?
I hate them with perfect hatred:
Search me, O God, and know my heart:
And see if there be any wicked way in me,

140.verse_text: Deliver me, O Jehovah, from the evil man; Preserve me from the violent man: Continually do they gather themselves together for war. Adders" poison is under their lips. [Selah Preserve me from the violent man: Who have purposed to thrust aside my steps. They have spread a net by the wayside; They have set gins for me. [Selah Give ear unto the voice of my supplications, O Jehovah. Thou hast covered my head in the day of battle. Further not his evil device, lest they exalt themselves. [Selah Let the mischief of their own lips cover them. Let them be cast into the fire, Into deep pits, whence they shall not rise. Evil shall hunt the violent man to overthrow him. And justice for the needy. The upright shall dwell in thy presence.
Who devise mischiefs in their heart;
They have sharpened their tongue like a serpent;
Keep me, O Jehovah, from the hands of the wicked;
The proud have hid a snare for me, and cords;
I said unto Jehovah, Thou art my God:
O Jehovah the Lord, the strength of my salvation,
Grant not, O Jehovah, the desires of the wicked;
As for the head of those that compass me about,
Let burning coals fall upon them:
An evil speaker shall not be established in the earth:
I know that Jehovah will maintain the cause of the afflicted,
Surely the righteous shall give thanks unto thy name:

141.verse_text: Jehovah, I have called upon thee; make haste unto me: Give ear unto my voice, when I call unto thee. The lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice. Keep the door of my lips. To practise deeds of wickedness With men that work iniquity: And let me not eat of their dainties. And let him reprove me, it shall be as oil upon the head; Let not my head refuse it: For even in their wickedness shall my prayer continue. And they shall hear my words; for they are sweet. Our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol. In thee do I take refuge; leave not my soul destitute. And from the gins of the workers of iniquity. Whilst that I withal escape.
Let my prayer be set forth as incense before thee;
Set a watch, O Jehovah, before my mouth;
Incline not my heart to any evil thing,
Let the righteous smite me, it shall be a kindness;
Their judges are thrown down by the sides of the rock;
As when one ploweth and cleaveth the earth,
For mine eyes are unto thee, O Jehovah the Lord:
Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me,
Let the wicked fall into their own nets,

142.verse_text: I cry with my voice unto Jehovah; With my voice unto Jehovah do I make supplication. I show before him my trouble. Thou knewest my path. In the way wherein I walk Have they hidden a snare for me. For there is no man that knoweth me: Refuge hath failed me; No man careth for my soul. I said, Thou art my refuge, My portion in the land of the living. For I am brought very low: Deliver me from my persecutors; For they are stronger than I. That I may give thanks unto thy name: The righteous shall compass me about; For thou wilt deal bountifully with me.
I pour out my complaint before him;
When my spirit was overwhelmed within me,
Look on my right hand, and see;
I cried unto thee, O Jehovah;
Bring my soul out of prison,

143.verse_text: Hear my prayer, O Jehovah; give ear to my supplications: In thy faithfulness answer me, and in thy righteousness. For in thy sight no man living is righteous. He hath smitten my life down to the ground: He hath made me to dwell in dark places, as those that have been long dead. My heart within me is desolate. I meditate on all thy doings; I muse on the work of thy hands. My soul thirsteth after thee, as a weary land. [Selah Hide not thy face from me, Lest I become like them that go down into the pit. For in thee do I trust: Cause me to know the way wherein I should walk; For I lift up my soul unto thee. I flee unto thee to hide me. For thou art my God: Thy Spirit is good; Lead me in the land of uprightness. In thy righteousness bring my soul out of trouble. And destroy all them that afflict my soul; For I am thy servant.
And enter not into judgment with thy servant;
For the enemy hath persecuted my soul;
Therefore is my spirit overwhelmed within me;
I remember the days of old;
I spread forth my hands unto thee:
Make haste to answer me, O Jehovah; my spirit faileth:
Cause me to hear thy lovingkindness in the morning;
Deliver me, O Jehovah, from mine enemies:
Teach me to do thy will;
Quicken me, O Jehovah, for thy name"s sake:
And in thy lovingkindness cut off mine enemies,

144.verse_text: Blessed be Jehovah my rock, Who teacheth my hands to war, And my fingers to fight: My high tower, and my deliverer; My shield, and he in whom I take refuge; Who subdueth my people under me. Or the son of man, that thou makest account of him? His days are as a shadow that passeth away. Touch the mountains, and they shall smoke. Send out thine arrows, and discomfit them. Rescue me, and deliver me out of great waters, Out of the hand of aliens; And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood. Upon a psaltery of ten strings will I sing praises unto thee. Who rescueth David his servant from the hurtful sword. Whose mouth speaketh deceit, And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood. And our daughters as corner-stones hewn after the fashion of a palace; And our sheep bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our fields; When there is no breaking in, and no going forth, And no outcry in our streets: Yea , happy is the people whose God is Jehovah.
Jehovah, what is man, that thou takest knowledge of him?
Bow thy heavens, O Jehovah, and come down:
Cast forth lightning, and scatter them;
Stretch forth thy hand from above;
I will sing a new song unto thee, O God:
Thou art he that giveth salvation unto kings;
Rescue me, and deliver me out of the hand of aliens,
When our sons shall be as plants grown up in their youth,
When our garners are full, affording all manner of store,
When our oxen are well laden;
Happy is the people that is in such a case;

145.verse_text: I will extol thee, my God, O King; And I will bless thy name for ever and ever. And I will praise thy name for ever and ever. And his greatness is unsearchable. And shall declare thy mighty acts. And of thy wondrous works, will I meditate. And I will declare thy greatness. And shall sing of thy righteousness. Slow to anger, and of great lovingkindness. And his tender mercies are over all his works. And thy saints shall bless thee. And talk of thy power; And the glory of the majesty of his kingdom. And thy dominion endureth throughout all generations. And raiseth up all those that are bowed down. And thou givest them their food in due season. And satisfiest the desire of every living thing. And gracious in all his works. To all that call upon him in truth. He also will hear their cry and will save them. But all the wicked will he destroy. And let all flesh bless his holy name for ever and ever.
Every day will I bless thee;
Great is Jehovah, and greatly to be praised;
One generation shall laud thy works to another,
Of the glorious majesty of thine honor,
And men shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts;
They shall utter the memory of thy great goodness,
Jehovah is gracious, and merciful;
Jehovah is good to all;
All thy works shall give thanks unto thee, O Jehovah;
They shall speak of the glory of thy kingdom,
To make known to the sons of men his mighty acts,
Thy kingdom is an everlasting kingdom,
Jehovah upholdeth all that fall,
The eyes of all wait for thee;
Thou openest thy hand,
Jehovah is righteous in all his ways,
Jehovah is nigh unto all them that call upon him,
He will fulfil the desire of them that fear him;
Jehovah preserveth all them that love him;
My mouth shall speak the praise of Jehovah;

146.verse_text: Praise ye Jehovah. Praise Jehovah, O my soul. I will sing praises unto my God while I have any being. Nor in the son of man, in whom there is no help. In that very day his thoughts perish. Whose hope is in Jehovah his God: The sea, and all that in them is; Who keepeth truth for ever; Who giveth food to the hungry. Jehovah looseth the prisoners; Jehovah raiseth up them that are bowed down; Jehovah loveth the righteous; He upholdeth the fatherless and widow; But the way of the wicked he turneth upside down. Thy God, O Zion, unto all generations. Praise ye Jehovah.
While I live will I praise Jehovah:
Put not your trust in princes,
His breath goeth forth, he returneth to his earth;
Happy is he that hath the God of Jacob for his help,
Who executeth justice for the oppressed;
Jehovah openeth the eyes of the blind;

147.verse_text: Praise ye Jehovah; For it is good to sing praises unto our God; For it is pleasant, and praise is comely. He gathereth together the outcasts of Israel. And bindeth up their wounds. He calleth them all by their names. His understanding is infinite. He bringeth the wicked down to the ground. Sing praises upon the harp unto our God, Who prepareth rain for the earth, Who maketh grass to grow upon the mountains. And to the young ravens which cry. He taketh no pleasure in the legs of a man. In those that hope in his lovingkindness. Praise thy God, O Zion. He hath blessed thy children within thee. He filleth thee with the finest of the wheat. His word runneth very swiftly. He scattereth the hoar-frost like ashes. Who can stand before his cold? He causeth his wind to blow, and the waters flow. His statutes and his ordinances unto Israel. And as for his ordinances, they have not known them. Praise ye Jehovah.
Jehovah doth build up Jerusalem;
He healeth the broken in heart,
He counteth the number of the stars;
Great is our Lord, and mighty in power;
Jehovah upholdeth the meek:
Sing unto Jehovah with thanksgiving;
Who covereth the heavens with clouds,
He giveth to the beast his food,
He delighteth not in the strength of the horse:
Jehovah taketh pleasure in them that fear him,
Praise Jehovah, O Jerusalem;
For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates;
He maketh peace in thy borders;
He sendeth out his commandment upon earth;
He giveth snow like wool;
He casteth forth his ice like morsels:
He sendeth out his word, and melteth them:
He showeth his word unto Jacob,
He hath not dealt so with any nation;

148.verse_text: Praise ye Jehovah. Praise ye Jehovah from the heavens: Praise him in the heights. Praise ye him, all his host. Praise him, all ye stars of light. And ye waters that are above the heavens. For he commanded, and they were created. He hath made a decree which shall not pass away. Ye sea-monsters, and all deeps; Stormy wind, fulfilling his word; Fruitful trees and all cedars; Creeping things and flying birds; Princes and all judges of the earth; Old men and children: For his name alone is exalted; His glory is above the earth and the heavens. The praise of all his saints; Even of the children of Israel, a people near unto him. Praise ye Jehovah.
Praise ye him, all his angels:
Praise ye him, sun and moon:
Praise him, ye heavens of heavens,
Let them praise the name of Jehovah;
He hath also established them for ever and ever:
Fire and hail, snow and vapor;
Kings of the earth and all peoples;
Let them praise the name of Jehovah;
And he hath lifted up the horn of his people,

149.verse_text: Praise ye Jehovah. Sing unto Jehovah a new song, And his praise in the assembly of the saints. Let the children of Zion be joyful in their King. Let them sing praises unto him with timbrel and harp. He will beautify the meek with salvation. Let them sing for joy upon their beds. And a two-edged sword in their hand; And punishments upon the peoples; And their nobles with fetters of iron; This honor have all his saints. Praise ye Jehovah.
Let Israel rejoice in him that made him:
Let them praise his name in the dance:
For Jehovah taketh pleasure in his people:
Let the saints exult in glory:
Let the high praises of God be in their mouth,
To execute vengeance upon the nations,
To bind their kings with chains,
To execute upon them the judgment written:

150.verse_text: Praise ye Jehovah. Praise God in his sanctuary: Praise him in the firmament of his power. Praise him according to his excellent greatness. Praise him with psaltery and harp. Praise him with stringed instruments and pipe. Praise him with high sounding cymbals. Praise ye Jehovah.
Praise him for his mighty acts:
Praise him with timbrel and dance:
Let everything that hath breath praise Jehovah.
